revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=October 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=October 2018}} {{more citations needed|date=February 2016}} {{infobox person |name=Abul Kashem Khan |image=Ayub Khan & A K Khan.jpg |caption= General [[Ayub Khan (President of Pakistan)|Ayub Khan]] at the residence of Khan (right) in [[Chittagong]] (1960) |birth_date={{birth date|1905|4|5|df=y}} |birth_place= Mohara village, Panchlaish Thana, [[Eastern Bengal and Assam]], [[British India]] |nationality=Bangladeshi |death_date={{death date and age|1991|3|31|1905|4|5|df=y}} |occupation=Industrialist }} '''Abul Kashem Khan''' (best known as '''A. K. Khan'''; 5 April 1905 – 31 March 1991) was a [[Pashtuns|Pashtun]]-[[Bangladeshi]] lawyer, industrialist and politician. In 1945, he founded [[A K Khan & Company]], one of Pakistan's leading [[Conglomerate (company)|conglomerates]] until 1971, when it became one of Bangladesh's leading conglomerates.<ref name=":0">{{cite web|last1=Islam|first1=Sirajul|title=Khan, Abul Kashem|url=http://en.banglapedia.org/index.php?title=Khan,_Abul_Kashem|website=banglapedia|accessdate=24 January 2016}}</ref> Khan served as a member of the [[Constituent Assembly of India]] and the [[Constituent Assembly of Pakistan]]. He was a federal minister of [[Pakistan]] and member in the [[Pakistan National Assembly]].
== Early life == Khan was born in the Village of Mohara in [[Panchlaish Thana|Panchlaish]] in [[Chittagong]] in 1905. His father was a government sub-registrar at Fatehabad, Chittagong. He studied law at [[Presidency University, Kolkata|Presidency College]], [[Calcutta]]. In 1934 he joined the Kolkata High court as an advocate. He joined the judicial branch of the Bengali Civil service in 1935. He continued in the service till 1944.<ref name=":0"/>
== Career == Khan entered business during the [[Second World War]] in 1945, when Chittagong was a key base for Allied Forces. He step up a number of industries including a match factory, a plywood factory, a textile mill, and dockyard. He was elected a member of the Constituent Assembly of India from the [[All-India Muslim League]] candidate in 1946. He joined the Pakistan Constituent Assembly after the partition of India. In 1951-1952 budget he spoke against the economical discrimination of East Pakistan.<ref name=":0"/>
''"Sir, I cannot help' remark ' which I hope will not be misinterpreted as an indication of petty provincial-mindedness. Sir, these are the days of decentralisation and regional self-sufficiency. We find that in this six-year plan, the total sum allocated to East Bengal where 56 percent of your people live is less than 23 percent. Under the head 'Agriculture', provision has been made for 82 crores and a sum total of all the projects envisaged for East Bengal is only 5.6 crores. Under the head 'Development of Hydro-Electric Power', a provision for 45 crores has been made and the share of East Bengal is only 5 crores. Under the head 'Industries', provision has been made for textile industries' [for West Pakistan] to the tune of 30 crores and the provision for jute industry' [for East Bengal] is only 11 crores. Now, Sir, this gives a clear indication that not only in the past, not only in the present, but in the future development plans of the country, East Bengal is not expected to get its legitimate share."''<ref name=":0"/><ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Szfqq7ruqWgC|title=Bangladesh: Past and Present|last=Ahmed|first=Salahuddin|date=2004-01-01|publisher=APH Publishing|isbn=9788176484695|page=337|language=en}}</ref>
He was the minister of Industries, Works, Irrigation, Power and Mineral Resources from 1958 to 1962. From 1962 to 1964 he was a member of the national assembly of Pakistan. He retired from politics in 1965.<ref name=":0"/>
== Death == He died on 31 March 1991.<ref name=":0"/>
==In popular culture== '''AK Khan More''' is a circle located in Chittagong, Bangladesh near Dhaka-Chittagong Trunk Road.
== References == {{Reflist}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2016}} {{Infobox newspaper | name = Al Alam Al Youm
العالم اليوم | logo = | image = | caption = | type = Six times per week | format = | owners = Gn4me Holding Company | founder = Yasser Thabet
Emad Adeeb | publisher = | editor = | chiefeditor = | assoceditor = | maneditor = | newseditor = | managingeditordesign = | campuseditor = | campuschief = | opeditor = | sportseditor = | photoeditor = | staff = | foundation = {{start date and age|1991}} | political = Independent | language = [[Arabic language|Arabic]] | ceased publication = | headquarters = [[Cairo]] | circulation = | sister newspapers =''[[Nahdet Misr]]'' | ISSN = | oclc = | website = }} '''''Al Alam Al Youm''''' (in [[Arabic language|Arabic]] العالم اليوم meaning ''The World Today'' in English){{cite book|title=Who's Who in the Arab World 2007-2008|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=NHCQBAFMwawC&pg=PA23|accessdate=2 January 2014|date=1 January 2007|publisher=Walter de Gruyter|isbn=978-3-11-093004-7|page=23}} is an [[Arabic]] business newspaper published in [[Cairo]], [[Egypt]]. It is the first private specialized independent paper of the country. ==History and profile== ''Al Alam Al Youm'', based in Cairo, was launched in 1991 as a first business newspaper in Egypt.{{cite book|title=African Media and ICT4D: Documentary Evidence: a Baseline Study on the State of Media Reporting on ICT and Information Society Issues in Africa|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=g9UUp5BkUPIC&pg=PA32|accessdate=2 January 2014|year=2003|publisher=United Nations Publications|isbn=978-92-1-125088-6|page=32}} In addition, it is the first privately owned independent newspaper of the country. [[Yasser Thabet]] and Emad Adeeb are the founders of the paper.{{cite web|title=Yasser Thabet|url=http://www.culturaldiplomacy.org/academy/index.php?Dr-Yasser-Thabet|work=Institute for Cultural Diplomacy|accessdate=2 January 2014}}{{cite book|author=Andrew Hammond|title=Pop Culture Arab World!: Media, Arts, and Lifestyle|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=m4eodEw7ZvsC&pg=PA76|accessdate=11 November 2014|year=2005|publisher=ABC-CLIO|isbn=978-1-85109-449-3|page=76}}{{cite web|title=Senior Management|url=http://www.gnmediagroup.com/seniormanage.aspx|work=Good News Media Group|accessdate=11 November 2014}} The owner of the paper is Good New 4Me Holding Company which also owns ''[[Nahdet Misr]]'', another newspaper.[http://www.artoc.com/divisions-investment.htm Divisions] ''Artoc''. Retrieved 2 January 2014.[http://www.menassat.com/?q=en/media-landscape/media-landscape-4 Media Landscape] ''Menassat''. Retrieved 2 January 2014. Emad Adeeb is also the chairman{{cite journal|author=Asma Yousef|title=Post-9/11 Media Coverage of International News|journal=Washington Report on Middle East Affairs|date=August 2002|volume=21|issue=6|url=https://www.questia.com/read/1P3-147231201/post-9-11-media-coverage-of-international-news|accessdate=3 January 2014}}{{subscription required|via=Questia}}{{cite news|title=Emad el-Din Adeeb: The Return of "Citizen Mubarak"|url=http://english.al-akhbar.com/node/3839|accessdate=5 January 2014|newspaper=Al Akhbar|date=2 February 2012|author=Mohammad Abdel Rahman}} and [[Lamis Elhadidy]] is the [[chief executive officer]] of the paper.{{cite web|title=Muslim Women: Past and Present|url=http://www.wisemuslimwomen.org/muslimwomen/bio/lamees_el_hadidi/|work=WISE|accessdate=2 January 2014}} It is published six times per week and focuses on business news in relation to Egypt, the [[Middle East]] and the other parts of the world.{{cite web|title=Al Alam Al Youm |url=http://www.cityscapeegypt.com/en/Exhibiting/CSEGExhibitorList/ExhibitorList21/Al-Alam-Al-Youm/ |work=City Scape Egypt |accessdate=2 January 2014 |year=2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140102191919/http://www.cityscapeegypt.com/en/Exhibiting/CSEGExhibitorList/ExhibitorList21/Al-Alam-Al-Youm/ |archivedate=2 January 2014 }}{{cite web|title=AppliTek featured in Egyptian business newspaper Al Alam Al Youm|url=http://www.applitek.com/en/news/2008-archives/applitek-featured-in-egyptian-business-newspaper-al-alam-al-youm/|work=AppliTek|accessdate=2 January 2014|date=26 May 2008}} The paper also offers financial analyses. Its target audiences include [[opinion leaders]], businesswomen and men, and decision-makers at [[Multinational corporation|multinational]] and [[private companies]]. The paper has offices in [[Paris]], [[London]], [[Geneva]], [[Bonn]], [[Saudi Arabia]], [[Kuwait]], [[Qatar]], [[Bahrain]], [[Morocco]], and [[Beirut]]. It publishes an Egyptian edition and a Gulf region edition. In 2003, the approximate number of its readers was 650,000 and the circulation was 15,000 copies.{{cite book|author=William A. Rugh|title=Arab Mass Media: Newspapers, Radio, and Television in Arab Politics|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=UGfbluSa4N8C&pg=PA123|accessdate=2 January 2014|year=2004|publisher=Greenwood Publishing Group|isbn=978-0-275-98212-6|page=123}} The 2005 circulation of the paper was 35,000 copies.{{cite web|title=Zoellick's visit to Egypt (July 13–14)|url=https://wikileaks.org/plusd/cables/05CAIRO5477_a.html|work=Wikileaks|accessdate=2 January 2014|date=18 July 2005}} ==See also== * [[List of newspapers in Egypt]] ==References== {{Reflist|33em}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Alam Al Youm, Al}} [[Category:1991 establishments in Egypt]] [[Category:Arabic-language newspapers]] [[Category:Business in Egypt]] [[Category:Business newspapers]] [[Category:Newspapers published in Egypt]] [[Category:Media in Giza]] [[Category:Publications established in 1991]]

The '''Ansoff Matrix''' is a [[strategic planning]] tool that provides a framework to help executives, senior managers, and marketers devise strategies for future growth.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.spencertom.com/2013/10/09/ansoff-matrix/#.U60YwZSSz3Q|title=Quick MBA: Ansoff Matrix| publisher=quickmba.com|accessdate = 27 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.mbaskool.com/business-concepts/marketing-and-strategy-terms/2550-ansoff-matrix.html|title=MBASkool: Ansoff Matrix| publisher=mbaskool.com|accessdate = 27 June 2014}}</ref> It is named after [[Russian American]] [[H. Igor Ansoff|Igor Ansoff]], who created the concept.
[[File:Ansoff Matrix.JPG|thumb|Diagram showing the Ansoff Matrix]]
== Growth strategies ==
Ansoff, in his 1957 paper, provided a definition for [[Product marketing|product-market]] strategy as “a joint statement of a product line and the corresponding set of missions which the products are designed to fulfil”.<ref>Ansoff, I.: Strategies for Diversification, Harvard Business Review, Vol. 35 Issue 5,Sep-Oct 1957, pp. 113-124</ref> He describes four growth alternatives:
===Market penetration===
In [[market penetration]] strategy, the organization tries to grow using its existing offerings (products and services) in existing markets. In other words, it tries to increase its [[market share]] in current market scenario.This involves increasing market share within existing market segments. This can be achieved by selling more products or services to established customers or by finding new customers within existing markets. Here, the company seeks increased sales for its present products in its present markets through more aggressive promotion and distribution.
This can be accomplished by: * Price decrease * Increase in promotion and distribution support * Acquisition of a rival in the same market * Modest product refinements
===Market development===
In [[market development]] strategy, a firm tries to expand into new markets (geographies, countries etc.) using its existing offerings.
This can be accomplished by: * Different customer segments * Industrial buyers for a good that was previously sold only to the households; * New areas or regions about of the country * Foreign markets.
This strategy is more likely to be successful where: * The firm has a unique product technology it can leverage in the new market * It benefits from economies of scale if it increases output * The new market is not too different from the one it has experience of * The buyers in the market are intrinsically profitable.
===Product development===
In [[product development]] strategy, a company tries to create new products and services targeted at its existing markets to achieve growth. This involves extending the product range available to the firm's existing markets. These products may be obtained by: * Investment in research and development of additional products; * Acquisition of rights to produce someone else's product; * Buying in the product and “badging” it as one’s own brand; * Joint development with ownership of another company who need access to the firm's distribution channels or brands.
===Diversification===
In [[Diversification (marketing strategy)|diversification]] an organization tries to grow its market share by introducing new offerings in new markets. It is the most risky strategy because both product and market development is required.
Related Diversification—here there is relationship and, therefore, potential synergy, between the firms in existing business and the new product/market space. {{clarify |date=November 2018|reason=Not a proper sentence, and (b) has no corresponding (a) part.|text=Concentric diversification, and (b) Vertical integration.}}
Unrelated Diversification: This is otherwise termed conglomerate growth because the resulting corporation is a conglomerate, i.e. a collection of businesses without any relationship to one another. A strategy for company growth through starting up or acquiring businesses outside the company’s current products and markets.
== Criticisms ==
=== Logical consistency challenges === The logic of the Ansoff matrix has been questioned. The logical issues pertain to interpretations about newness. If one assumes a new product really is new to the firm, in many cases a new product will simultaneously take the firm into a new, unfamiliar market. In that case, one of the Ansoff quadrants, diversification, is redundant. Alternatively, if a new product does ''not'' necessarily take the firm into a new market, then the combination of new products into new markets does not always equate to diversification, in the sense of venturing into a completely unknown business.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3130530|title=The Ansoff Matrix: a legendary tool, but with two logical problems|last=Dawes|first=John|date=2018|website=Social Science Research Network|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
==See also==
* [[Business model]] * [[Business triage]] * [[First-mover advantage]] * [[Marketing]] * [[Market segmentation]] * [[Strategic planning]]

([[US$]] 3.00 million) | religion = | signature = | signature_alt = | website = | twitter = | facebook = | footnotes = }} '''Antonio de Jesús Cruz Torres''' (born 30 October 1957) is a businessman and politician from the [[Dominican Republic]]. He is [[Senator]] for the [[Provinces of the Dominican Republic|province]] of [[Santiago Rodríguez Province|Santiago Rodríguez]], elected in 2006, and re-elected in 2010.{{cite web|title=Senador de la República por la Provincia Duarte, PLD. |url=http://www.senadord.com/rep_perfil_antonio.html |accessdate=21 August 2014 |language=Spanish |publisher=Senate of the Dominican Republic}} == References == {{Reflist}} {{DominicanRepublic-politician-stub}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cruz Torres, Antonio}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1957 births]] [[Category:People from Santiago Rodríguez Province]] [[Category:Dominican Liberation Party politicians]] [[Category:Dominican Republic people of Spanish descent]] [[Category:Dominican Republic businesspeople]] [[Category:Members of the Senate of the Dominican Republic]]

[[Yashovardhan Birla]]
Siddharth Birla|otherfamilies =|distinctions =|traditions = [[Hindu]]|heirlooms =|estate =|meaning =|footnotes =|colour = powderblue|homepage = {{URL|http://www.ckbirlagroup.com/}}}} The '''Birla family''' is a family connected with the industrial and social history of India.{{cite web |url=http://www.adityabirla.com |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2011-11-29 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111129203833/http://www.adityabirla.com/ |archivedate=2011-11-29 |df= }}{{cite web|url=http://www.ckbirlagroup.com|title=CK Birla Group - Birla Companies - Family - US$1.6 billion diversified conglomerate that has a history of enduring relationships with renowned global companies.|website=www.ckbirlagroup.com|accessdate=9 July 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/specials/yash-birla-s-business-comes-under-stress-114021701657_1.html|title=Yash Birla's business comes under stress|first=Dev Chatterjee & Sharleen|last=D'souza|date=17 February 2014|publisher=|accessdate=9 July 2017|via=Business Standard}} ==Foundations== The Birla family belongs to the [[Maheshwari]] subcaste of the [[Vaishya]] (trader) caste, and are [[Marwari people|Marwari]] since they hail from the [[Marwad]] region of present-day [[Rajasthan]]. Specifically, the family originates from the town of [[Pilani]] in the [[Shekhawati]] region lying between Marwad. ===Shiv Narayan Birla=== In Pilani during the early 19th century lived Seth Shobharam, grandson of Seth Bhudharmal, a local tradesman of modest means.Maheshwari Jati Ka Itihas, Maheshwari History Office, Bhanpura, Birla, June 1940, p. 183–190{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=pDlj7rwlDK0C&pg=PT684&lpg=PT684&dq=birla+daughters&source=bl&ots=c8DJbj8f7J&sig=iLvCokhf2N03_-OBQhAlHW6X5dM&hl=en&sa=X&ei=Q1JJVa28AoiZyATZ54GQCQ&ved=0CDUQ6AEwBDge#v=onepage&q=birla+daughters&f=false|title=Brushes With History|first=Krishna Kumar|last=Birla|date=17 April 2009|publisher=Penguin UK|accessdate=9 July 2017|via=Google Books}} It was his son, Seth Shiv Narayana (1840–1909), who first ventured outside Pilani. At this time, Ahmedabad was the railhead which serviced trade from a large region of northwest India. Goods (mainly cotton) would be brought from the hinterland to the city and sent from there by train to Bombay for export to England and other countries. Several cotton ginning units were also set up in Ahmedabad, to clean the cotton before shipment to England. Shiv Narayana Birla was one of the early Indian traders to participate in this cotton trade. Later, Britain vigorously fostered the trade of opium with China and developed the cultivation of poppy in India. The [[Ratlam]]-[[Mandsaur]] region (not far from Ahemdabad) became prime poppy cropland due to suitable soil and climate. Shiv Narayan Birla and his adopted son, Baldeo Das Birla, made an enormous fortune by trading opium with China, and this formed the basis of the family's fortune. With growing wealth and increasing confidence, Shiv Narayana Birla moved up the value chain and began chartering cargo ships in partnership with other Marwadi tradesmen to trade opium with China, thus by-passing British middlemen. To facilitate this, he moved to Bombay in 1863. ===Baldeo Das Birla=== Shiv Narain Birla had one overwhelming sorrow in his life: he had no children. By the early 1880s, Shiv narayan (Narain) had passed on the baton of his business interests to his adopted son, Baldeo Das Birla, established Shivnarayan Baldevdas, a trading house based in Bombay. His son, Baldeo Das Birla moved to Calcutta set up Baldevdas Jugalkishor in 1887. Baldeo Das was succeeded by four sons {{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qhe3-G5aBkg|title=The story of the Birla empire by Talveen Singh- Part I|first=|last=Aditya Birla Group|date=31 May 2011|publisher=|accessdate=9 July 2017|via=YouTube}}– Jugal Kishore, Rameshwar Das, [[Ghanshyam Das Birla|Ghanshyam Das]] and Braj Mohan.[http://www.icmrindia.org/casestudies/catalogue/Business%20Strategy3/BSTA034.htm The Birla Family Crisis - Case Studies, Case Study in Business, Management|Case Studies] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714221045/http://www.icmrindia.org/casestudies/catalogue/Business%20Strategy3/BSTA034.htm |date=July 14, 2014 }}{{cite web|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/battle-for-m.p.-birla-fortune-icai-indicts-lodhas/1/175181.html|title=Battle for Billions: Birlas vs Lodhas|publisher=|accessdate=9 July 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/life-style/books/What-keeps-the-Marwaris-thriving/articleshow/35380786.cms|title=What keeps the Marwaris thriving? - Times of India|publisher=|accessdate=9 July 2017}} Baldeo Das was awarded the Raibahadur title in 1917. In 1920 he retired from business and started living in Banares pursuing religious studies. In 1925 he was awarded the title of "Raja" by the government of Bihar and Orissa.Industrial Entrepreneurship of Shekhawati Marwaris, D.K. Taknet, Kumar Prakashan, Jaipur, 1987, p. 41 He was awarded D. Litt. by Beneras Hindu University. ===Ghanshyam Das Birla=== Ghanshyam Das Birla laid the foundation of his industrial empire by establishing GM Birla Company, trading in [[jute]], in 1911. The [[First World War]] began in 1914 greatly increasing the demand for jute sacks. During the war the Birla's worth is estimated to have risen from 2 million rupees to 8 million.{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=xcbBEHHI-90C&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false|title=India's Industrialists|first1=Margaret|last1=Herdeck|first2=Gita|last2=Piramal|date=9 July 1985|publisher=Lynne Rienner Publishers|accessdate=9 July 2017|via=Google Books}} In 1919, he became among the first group of Indian entrepreneurs to become owner of a Jute mill named [[Birla Corporation|Birla Jute]].{{cite web|url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/magazines/corporate-dossier/family-spirit-and-frugality-help-the-birlas-keep-pace-with-changing-times/articleshow/41702203.cms?intenttarget=no|title='Family' spirit and frugality help the Birlas keep pace with changing times|date=6 September 2014|publisher=|accessdate=9 July 2017|via=The Economic Times}} In the next few years he acquired several cotton mills. He later started several sugar mills. The publication [[Hindustan Times]] was co-founded by GD Birla in 1924 and fully acquired by him in 1933. [[Hindustan Motors]] was started in 1942. After India's independence in 1947 he started [[Grasim]] (Gwalior Rayon Silk Manufacturing, 1948) and [[Hindalco]] (Hindustan Aluminium Company 1958) among others. Baldeo Das, as well his sons were among the key supporters of the [[swaraj]] movement led by Mahatma Gandhi, in addition to being dedicated Hindu activists. They were active supporters of the [[Banaras Hindu University]] founded by Pt. [[Madan Mohan Malaviya]] and were also financial supporters of activities initiated by Mahatma Gandhi.Business Legends, Gita Piramal, Penguin UK, Dec 1, 2010 The landmark [[Laxminarayan Temple]] in Delhi was built by Jugal Kishore Birla and was inaugurated by Mahatma Gandhi and as asked by Mahatma, all Hindus, including [[harijan]]s were welcomed in this temple. In the few decades before India's independence, Indian merchants, including the Birlas, made successful attempts to enter and acquire industries in India which were once dominated by [[Scot]]s from Britain.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/1943/01/02/archives/british-investors-see-peril-in-india-managing-agents-fear-loss-of.html|title=British Investors See Peril in India – Managing Agents Fear Loss of Immense Profits on Half of Country's Industries – Natives Seek Business – Huge Sterling Credits Already Available to Buy Out the Foreign Companies|first=Herbert L.|last=Matthews|date=2 January 1943|page=5| work=New York Times|accessdate=9 July 2017}} This became a part of Mahatma Gandhi's [[Swadeshi]] movement. Birlas remained close to some of the leaders of India, like [[Sardar Patel]] after India's independence.Debajyoti Burman, Mystery of Birla House, Jugabani Hahitya Chakara, 3rd reprint 1951, P. 111 As leading industrialists, they were often accused by the leftists of exploiting their workers and aspiring to be among the richest in the world. Still when [[E. M. S. Namboodiripad]] became the chief minister of Kerala (1957–59), as a result of the first elected Marxist government anywhere, Birlas were invited to establish a pulp factory there.Phrases And Facts: About Kerala, Partha Choudhuri, Liberation, Vol. II, No. 3 (January 1969). In recent past, the Birlas, as well as several other Indian industrialists have expanded overseas. {{cite web|last=Piramal|first=Gita|url=http://www.india-seminar.com/1999/482/482%20piramal.htm|title= A crisis of leadership|date=October 1999|work=Family Business, a symposium on the role of the family in Indian business|publisher=|accessdate=9 July 2017}} ==Family Tree of Male MembersThis follows the common conventions. KK Birla’s daughters Nandini Nopany, Jyotsna Poddar and Sobhana Bhartia, and BK Birla has two daughters, Manjushree Khaitan and Jayashree Mohta have inherited roles in some of their fathers' businesses or charities.{{cite web|url=http://epaper.timesofindia.com/Repository/getFiles.asp?Style=OliveXLib:LowLevelEntityToPrint_ETNEW&Type=text/html&Locale=english-skin-custom&Path=ETM/2011/07/04&ID=Ar00600|title=In a First, a Daughter’s Son Rises at Birla Abode|website=epaper.timesofindia.com|accessdate=9 July 2017}}== {{chart top|width=100%}} {{chart/start|align=center}} {{chart| | | | | | | | | | | | SNB | |SNB=[[Shiv Narain Birla]]}} {{chart| | | | | | | | | | | | |!|}} {{chart| | | | | | | | | | | | BDB | |BDB=[[Baldeo Das Birla]]}} {{chart| | | |,|-|-|-|v|-|-|-|-|^|-|-|-|-|v|-|-|-|-|-|-|-|.|}} {{chart| | | JK | | RD | | | | | | | | GD | | | | | | BM |JK=[[Jugal Kishore Birla]]|RD=[[Rameshwar Das Birla]]|GD=[[Ghanshyam Das Birla]]|BM=Braj Mohan}} {{chart| | | | | |,|-|^|-|.| | | |,|-|-|-|+|-|-|-|.| | | |!| }} {{chart| | | | | Gj | | MP | | LN | | KK | | BK | | GP | | |Gj=Gajanan|MP=[[Madhav Prasad Birla]]|LN=Lakshmi Niwas|KK=[[Krishna Kumar Birla]]|BK=[[Basant Kumar Birla]]|GP=[[Ganga Prasad Birla]]}} {{chart| | | | | |!| | | | | | | |!| | | | | | | |!| | | |!| }} {{chart| | | | | Ak | | | | | | Sd | | | | | | AV | | CK | |Ak=Ashok|Sd=Sudarshan|AV=[[Aditya Vikram Birla]]|CK=[[CK Birla]]}} {{chart| | | | | |!| | | | | | | |!| | | | | | | |!| | | }} {{chart| | | | |Yo | | | | | | Sh | | | | | | KM | | |Yo=[[Yashovardhan Birla]]|Sh=Siddharth|KM=[[Kumar Mangalam Birla]]}} {{chart/end}} {{chart bottom}} ==Philanthropy== [[File:Gandhi at the Laxminarayan Temple.jpg|thumbnail|right| [[Gandhi]] inaugurating the [[Laxminarayan Temple]], Delhi, 1938, with the Birla family (Jugalkishor, Rameshwardas, Ghanshyamdas in black caps, Baldevdas in turban]] Birla philanthropy began in the 1880s, when the Birla family donated over 100,000 rupees for setting up goshalas (shelters for the protection of cows) in Kolkata. By early 1900, the Birla family began to support education, influenced by Pandit Madan Mohan Malaviya. They supported educational charities in Kolkata and in Mumbai teaming up with [[Jamnalal Bajaj]]. In 1918, the family established the first high school in Pilani which evolved into [[BITS Pilani]], which now has branches in Hyderabad, Goa and Dubai. They also opened a Sanskrit library in Benares and a library in Kolkata.{{cite web|url=http://www.livemint.com/Specials/XaccWERecP1ckwaJ4spx5O/Rajashree-Birla--Giving-is-in-fact-living.html|title=Rajashree Birla - Giving is in fact living|first=Rajashree|last=Birla|date=3 October 2014|publisher=|accessdate=9 July 2017}} It is well known for the financial support of Indian's freedom struggle and for building temples (see [[Birla Temple]]) in several major Indian cities. The institutions founded by the Birlas include: * [[Birla Planetarium (disambiguation)|Birla Planetarium]]s * [[Guru Hanuman]] Akhara * [[Aditya Birla Memorial Hospital]] * [[Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani]] * [[Birla Institute of Management Technology]] (BIMTECH), Greater Noidahttp://bimtech.ac.in/about/the-legacy-the-birla-group/ * [[Birla Global University]] Bhubaneswar, Odisha{{cite web|url=https://www.bgu.ac.in/|title=Birla Global University - Top University in BBSR, Odisha|website=www.bgu.ac.in|accessdate=9 July 2017}} * [[Birla Institute of Technology, Mesra]] * [[Birla Vishwakarma Mahavidyalaya]] * Birla Education Trust, Pilani * [[M. P. Birla Foundation Higher Secondary School]] * [[Technological Institute of Textile & Sciences]], Bhiwani * [[M. P. Birla Institute of Fundamental Research]] * [[Basant Kumar Birla#Philanthropy|BK Birla Group institutions]], [[Aditya Birla Group#Philanthropy|Aditya Birla Group Institutions]] * [[K. K. Birla Foundation]], established in 1991 by Krishna Kumar Birla, gives the annual awards like [[Saraswati Samman]], [[Vyas Samman]] and [[G.D. Birla Award for Scientific Research]].{{cite web | title = Govind Mishra gets Saraswati Samman 2013 for novel 'Dhool Paudhon Par' |work= Daily News & Analysis| url = http://www.dnaindia.com/india/report-govind-mishra-gets-saraswati-samman-2013-for-novel-dhool-paudhon-par-2020773 |date=22 September 2014 | accessdate = 2014-09-23 }} [[File:'Birla Brothers' Plaque at 'Dhosi Hill'.jpg|thumbnail|right| Birla Brothers' of Pilani, who established 'BITS, Pilani' also got constructed a Dam in the year 1944 or Vikrami Samvat 2000 on 'Dhosi Hill' to store rainy water for bathing of 'Pilgrims']] ==Birla values== In a letter, Ghanshaym Das offered this advice to Aditya (his grandson) when he was studying at MIT: :“eat only vegetarian food, never drink alcohol or smoke, keep early hours, marry young, switch-off lights when leaving the room, cultivate regular habits, go for a walk everyday, keep in touch with the family, and above all, don’t be extravagant.” India's Industrialists, Volume 1, Margaret Herdeck, Gita Piramal, Lynne Rienner Publishers, 1985 p. 97 GD Birla instructed his son Basant Kumar to 'never utilize wealth only for fun and frolic,' to 'spend the bare minimum on yourself,' and to deride 'worldly pleasures.' This advice symbolised the ethic of the rising Marwari community, with restraint and austerity its defining attributes.{{cite web|url=http://gurcharandas.org/node/634|title=Marwari ethic and the spirit of Capitalism - Gurcharan Das|website=gurcharandas.org|accessdate=9 July 2017}} ==Birla Family ties== Although the Birlas are perceived as a single entity, the different branches of the family are now financially independent.{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindubusinessline.com/2004/08/26/stories/2004082602130600.htm|title=The Hindu Business Line : `Mahatma was witness to Birla clan partition'|first=|last=cakml|website=www.thehindubusinessline.com|accessdate=9 July 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/after-months-of-tension-birlas-part-ways-amicably/1/337575.html|title=After months of tension, Birlas part ways amicably|publisher=|accessdate=9 July 2017}} However they have continued to maintain family relationships that go back to the times when "Birla Brothers" were an actual entity and Raja Baldevdas was still alive. Both of GD Birla's wives died early because of tuberculosis (He remarried after the death of his first wife), a common affliction at that time. The families of his brothers [[Ghanshyam Das Birla#Family history|Brij Mohan and Rameshwar Das Birla helped in raising his children]]. When Yash Birla's parents died in a plane crash, Priyamvada Birla, ("Badi Ma") helped take care of him.{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindu.com/features/magazine/yash-gets-candid/article5875980.ece|title=Yash gets candid|publisher=|accessdate=9 July 2017}} It is reported that Kumar Mangalam Birla had dipped into his own resources to help his beleaguered relative Yash with his financial issues with creditors, in order to preserve the family name.{{cite web|url=http://www.mid-day.com/articles/family-values/238587|title=Family Values|publisher=|accessdate=9 July 2017}} =="Tata-Birla" word pair== For many decades the extreme wealth in India was associated with the Tatas and Birlas. The words Tata-Birla were often used together.[http://www.mathrubhumi.com/english/news/columns/below-the-belt/capitalists-of-the-world-unite-4323.html Capitalists of the world, unite! Mathrubhumi, October 9, 2008] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402100733/http://www.mathrubhumi.com/english/news/columns/below-the-belt/capitalists-of-the-world-unite-4323.html |date=April 2, 2015 }} They were distantly followed by [[Dalmia Group|Dalmia]]s (Dalmia-Sahu Jain group) for some time,{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Pi5bAAAAMAAJ&q=Tata,+Birla,+Dalmia-Jain,+Hirachand,+B.+Mukherjee+and+M.+Chettiar&dq=Tata,+Birla,+Dalmia-Jain,+Hirachand,+B.+Mukherjee+and+M.+Chettiar&hl=en&sa=X&ei=V30gVZiIBYitogT6goCAAg&ved=0CB0Q6AEwAA|title=World Marxist Review|date=9 July 1970|publisher=Progress Books.|accessdate=9 July 2017|via=Google Books}} however Tatas and Birlas have been able to sustain themselves as among the most prominent industrialists in India (for 1939-1997 data see{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=X6knIE-47BAC&pg=PA290&lpg=PA290&dq=tata+birla+dalmia&source=bl&ots=b3ZlTXgn77&sig=tLsx13Ep23ORRTWJ_IrZ4ZEQzNE&hl=en&sa=X&ei=hasYVcaCApWyoQTi24DoDg&ved=0CE0Q6AEwBg#v=onepage&q=tata+birla+dalmia&f=false|title=A History of Corporate Governance around the World: Family Business Groups to Professional Managers|first=Randall K.|last=Morck|date=1 November 2007|publisher=University of Chicago Press|accessdate=9 July 2017|via=Google Books}}) while others have declined. [http://swaminomics.org/the-curse-of-too-many-sons/ The Curse of too-many Sons, Swaminathan S. Anklesaria Aiyar, Times of India, Nov 9, 1997]{{cite web|url=http://www.businessandeconomy.org/14122006/storyd.asp?sid=641&pageno=25|title=The Rise, Fall & Rise Of Indian Business Families|first=Website Developed by Ranjit Singh, Planman Media Pvt. Ltd., Delhi, India|last=9811747788|website=www.businessandeconomy.org|accessdate=9 July 2017}} A plan for development of India was developed by a group of industrialists in 1944, which was termed the Tata-Birla plan or the Bombay plan,{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=iLvyf6jQYqYC&pg=PA184&dq=Tata+Birla&hl=en&sa=X&ei=8a8YVYHjLtPaoASit4DgBA&ved=0CEgQ6AEwCA#v=onepage&q=Tata+Birla&f=false|title=Tata Consultancy Services Story- and Beyond|first=Subramaniam|last=Ramadorai|date=9 July 2017|publisher=Penguin Books India|accessdate=9 July 2017|via=Google Books}} which is said to have served as a blueprint for India's [[Five-Year Plans of India#First Plan .281951-1956.29|first five-year plan]]. Two South India comedy movies [[Tata Birla Madhyalo Laila]] and [[Tata Birla]] use the word pair. It also occurs in some songs.{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/tata-birla-song-is-not-meant-to-disrespect-anyone-prakash-jha/297699-8-66.html|title=News18.com: CNN News18 Latest News, Breaking News India, Current News Headlines|website=News18|accessdate=9 July 2017}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Birla Family}} [[Category:Family trees]] [[Category:Indian families]] [[Category:Hindu families]] [[Category:Business families of India]] [[Category:Birla family]]

revision.text:
{{other people|Robert Turner}} {{Use mdy dates|date=November 2015}} {{Infobox Congressman |name=Bob Turner |image = Bob Turner, official portrait, 112th Congress.jpg |size=220px |state = [[New York (state)|New York]] |district = [[New York's 9th congressional district|9th]] |term_start = September 13, 2011 |term_end = January 3, 2013 |predecessor = [[Anthony Weiner]] |successor = [[Yvette Clarke]] |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1941|5|2}} |birth_place = [[New York City, New York]] |party = [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] |spouse = Peggy Turner (1963–present) |children = 5 |residence = [[Breezy Point, Queens|Rockaway Point, Queens, New York City]] |education = [[Bachelor of Arts]] in history |alma_mater = [[St. John's University (New York)]] |profession = Media executive |religion = [[Catholic Church|Roman Catholicism]] <!--Military service--> |allegiance = [[United States]] |branch = [[United States Army]] |serviceyears = 1962–1965 |rank = [[File:E-5 - SPC5.PNG|20px]] [[Specialist (rank)#Specialist|SPC5]]<ref name="campaign site"/> }}
'''Robert L. Turner''' (born May 2, 1941) is an American businessman and politician who served as the [[United States House of Representatives|United States Representative]] for [[New York's 9th congressional district]], in the United States' 112th Congress (containing parts of [[Brooklyn]] and [[Queens]]), from 2011 to 2013. He is a member of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]]. Turner was elected in September 2011 to complete the term of Democrat [[Anthony Weiner]], who had [[Anthony Weiner sexting scandal|resigned following allegations of improper behavior.]]
Turner had been a media executive known for his success in the television talk show segment of the industry. Six years after retiring from his business career, he entered politics to run against Weiner in the November 2010 election—losing, receiving 39 percent of the vote. Less than one year later, he defeated Democrat [[David Weprin]] 52–47 in the [[New York's 9th congressional district special election, 2011|special election]] battle for Weiner's seat—becoming the first Republican to represent the area since 1923.<ref name="behind win"/> In [[United States Senate election in New York, 2012|2012]], after his district was eliminated in redistricting, Turner ran for the [[United States Senate]], but was defeated in the primaries.<ref name="cpnys.org">{{cite web|url=http://www.cpnys.org/posts/wendy-long-receives-conservative-party-endorsement|title=Wendy Long Receives Conservative Party Endorsement - Conservative Party of New York State|work=cpnys.org|accessdate=June 4, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402174102/http://www.cpnys.org/posts/wendy-long-receives-conservative-party-endorsement|archive-date=April 2, 2015|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref name="timesledger.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.timesledger.com/stories/2012/26/turnerprimary_all_2012_06_28_q.html|title=Long beats Turner in Republican contest for Senate|work=TimesLedger|accessdate=June 4, 2015}}</ref> Turner was named chairman of the Queens County chapter of the Republican Party in 2015.<ref>Campanile, Carl (March 9, 2015). [https://nypost.com/2015/03/09/bob-turner-to-be-next-chair-of-queens-gop/ Bob Turner to be next chair of Queens GOP]. ''The New York Post''. Retrieved March 9, 2015.</ref><ref>http://observer.com/2015/03/bob-turner-crowned-de-facto-chairman-of-queens-republican-party/</ref>
==Early life and education== Born in 1941,<ref name="bioguide"/> Turner grew up in the [[Woodhaven, Queens|Woodhaven]] and [[Richmond Hill, Queens|Richmond Hill]] neighborhoods of Queens, the eldest of three sons.<ref name="campaign site"/> His father was a taxi driver, and [[machinist]]; his mother a homemaker.<ref name="op-ed"/> Turner has described his parents as "[[New Deal|New Deal Democrats]] who began splitting their tickets in the post-[[John Kennedy|Kennedy]] years."<ref name="op-ed"/> He attended St. Thomas The Apostle School in [[Woodhaven, Queens|Woodhaven]] and [[Richmond Hill High School (Queens, New York)|Richmond Hill High School]]. He served in the Army at the rank of [[Specialist (rank)#Technician|SP5]], then graduated from [[St. John's University (New York)|St. John's University in Hillcrest]] with a [[B.A.]] in history, after working his way through college.<ref name="campaign site"/> As a college student, he took part in the conservative activist group [[Young Americans for Freedom]].<ref name="taps Weiner"/>
==Business career== [[File:Turner wins award from us chamber of commerce.jpg|thumb|right|Congressman Turner was awarded the United States Chamber of Commerce “Spirit of Enterprise Award” by [[U.S. Chamber of Commerce]] President and CEO [[Tom J. Donohue]] for his support of pro-business issues.]] Turner worked in the advertising and television industries for more than four decades.<ref name="campaign site"/> In 1984, he co-founded and ran Orbis Communications, a distributor of [[advertiser funded programming]].<ref name="campaign site"/><ref name="all american"/> He then headed the North American operations of Pearson LLC, where he exported the television [[talk show]] format to Europe, launching six shows in two years.<ref name="campaign site"/> In addition, Turner reorganized and redirected the successful program ''[[Baywatch]]'' and launched new versions of the game shows ''[[Family Feud]]'' and ''[[To Tell the Truth]]''.<ref name="campaign site"/><ref name="protest vote"/>
Turner's most notable position was president of [[Multimedia Entertainment]], a division of media conglomerate Multimedia, Inc., from 1991 to 1995.<ref name="campaign site"/><ref name="sharp drop"/> He created ''[[The Jerry Springer Show]]''.,<ref name="put rush"/> he oversaw the production of ''[[The Phil Donahue Show]]'' and ''[[Sally (1983 TV series)|The Sally Jesse Raphael Show]]'',<ref name="cowboy"/><ref name="man who created"/> and launched the [[Rush Limbaugh]] show on television.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/09/01/bob-turner-rush-limbaugh-tv-show_n_944949.html|title= Bob Turner Put Rush Limbaugh On Television, He's Proud To Say|author=Elise Foley|work=Huffington Post|date=September 1, 2011|accessdate=October 11, 2011}}</ref> [[Jerry Springer]] recalled that he and Turner had a friendly, businesslike relationship though their politics differed.<ref name="cowboy"/> Turner shelved several Springer show episodes as inappropriate but kept the show on the air despite heavy criticism and calls from Congress to regulate the show's raunchy content.<ref name="man who created"/><ref name="profile"/> Limbaugh recalled of Turner: "it was Bob Turner that chased Roger Ailes and me down one night at [[21 Club|21]] with the idea of doing a show. He was a great guy. He is a great guy. And he has the perfect temperament(...) and he was as loyal as the day is long."<ref>Benjamin, Liz (June 19, 2012). [http://www.capitaltonight.com/2012/06/extras-563/ Extras (#563)] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120620223429/http://www.capitaltonight.com/2012/06/extras-563/# |date=June 20, 2012 }}. ''State of Politics''. Retrieved June 20, 2012.</ref> Multimedia Entertainment was sold to Gannett Corporation for $2.1 billion in 1995 with Turner helping to orchestrate the sale. Gannett ended Rush Limbaugh's television show and Turner's 24-hour news talk station, the All-Talk Channel.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bobturnerforcongress.com/About_Bob.aspx|title=Bob Turner For Congress|work=Bob Turner For Congress|accessdate=June 4, 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222202001/http://www.bobturnerforcongress.com/About_Bob.aspx|archive-date=February 22, 2014|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cityhallnews.com/2011/08/during-turner%E2%80%99s-time-as-tv-mogul-a-sharp-drop-in-profits/ |title=During Bob Turner's Tenure Running Talk Show Company |access-date=September 2, 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110920034234/http://www.cityhallnews.com/2011/08/during-turner%E2%80%99s-time-as-tv-mogul-a-sharp-drop-in-profits/ |archive-date=September 20, 2011 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>[http://business.highbeam.com/137332/article-1G1-18107341/syndie-revolving-door Syndie's revolving door]</ref> In 1996, Multimedia Entertainment was sold to [[MCA Inc.|MCA]]/[[Universal Studios]]<ref>[http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-72821602.html Miller, Nick. "Gannett Sells Talk Shows"], ''[[The Cincinnati Post]]'', November 25, 1996. Retrieved March 2, 2011 from HighBeam Research.</ref>
He has also been President of LBS Communications, a division of [[Grey Global Group|Grey Advertising]], where he created a daytime "barter network" for the distribution and syndication of the series ''[[Family (1976 TV series)|Family]]'' and ''[[Fame (1982 TV series)|Fame]]''.<ref name="campaign site"/> He served as Director of Advertising for [[Bristol-Myers Squibb|Bristol-Myers]] Company, where he began the production of the Leonard Nimoy series, ''[[In Search of... (TV series)|In Search of...]]'', and was the first General Manager of [[CBS Cable]].<ref name="campaign site"/> During his active business career, Turner founded and served as the president of the Association of Syndicated Television Advertisers and was on the boards of the National Association of Television Programming Executives and the Advertising Research Council. He served on the television committee of the [[Association of National Advertisers]].<ref name="campaign site"/>
While in his early 60s, Turner retired from full-time business activities but continued to manage his own investments including a hotel business in Orlando, Florida.<ref name="campaign site"/> He sat on several Boards of Directors, including Readspeak Inc., Liberty Imaging Inc., the Achilles Track Club and Family Focus Adoption Services.<ref name="campaign site"/>
==Political career== Bob Turner recalled that he was motivated to join politics because of his opposition to the [[Obamacare|Health care bill]] and a perceived "radical left turn" that he felt the [[Obama administration]] was taking.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dailycaller.com/2010/10/18/the-man-who-brought-rush-limbaugh-to-television-looks-to-bring-down-liberal-new-york-rep-anthony-weiner/ |title=The man who brought Rush Limbaugh to television looks to bring down liberal New York Rep. Anthony Weiner |publisher=The Daily Caller |date=October 18, 2010 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref> He first ran for Congress in [[United States House of Representatives elections in New York, 2010|November 2010 against Anthony Weiner]] in New York's ninth congressional district, losing in a 60–40 split.<ref name="Tomasky"/> During the 2010 campaign, he ran on a platform favoring minimal regulation of business and signed the [[Grover Norquist]] / [[Americans for Tax Reform]] pledge of "no new taxes under any circumstances".<ref name="tax pledge"/>
===U.S. House of Representatives (2011–2013)=== Following the resignation of Anthony Weiner, Turner ran for the vacant seat in [[New York's 9th congressional district special election, 2011|a special election]] held on September 13, 2011—beating his Democratic opponent, [[David Weprin]], by a margin of more than 4,000 votes.<ref name="Officialresult"/> His campaign consultant was strategist [[Bill O'Reilly (political consultant)|Bill O'Reilly]]. Turner's campaign ran ads showing images of the [[World Trade Center site]] in flames, accusing Weprin of commemorating the attack by defending the right of Sufi Muslims to build the Islamic community center [[Park51]].<ref name="queenstribune"/><ref name="daily news endorses"/> Turner also said that Weprin would merely toe the Democratic Party line if elected<ref name="gop hopeful"/> and emphasized that Weprin had said the national debt was $4 trillion when the correct number was $14 trillion.<ref name="juniper civic"/> Turner, according to the ''New York Times'', "aggressively courted observant Jewish voters",<ref name="fearing loss"/> and painted Weprin as a puppet of President Obama, who would not stand up for Israel.<ref name="fearing loss"/><ref name="banks on"/> Turner won strong support from Orthodox Jewish leaders, and won crossover endorsements, two key ones being New York Assemblyman [[Dov Hikind]],<ref name="hikind endorses"/> and former New York Mayor [[Ed Koch]], both Democrats and Jews.<ref name="NYT2011/09/15"/><ref name="turner offers"/>
Turner began the campaign with a disadvantage in fundraising because the national and state Republican parties had spent heavily in previous special elections in New York state.<ref name="weprin leads"/> Turner turned down [[Tea Party movement|Tea Party]] support and offers to help during his special election campaign.<ref name="brown in queens"/> Regardless, Turner rose in the polls from an underdog to an eight-point advantage days before the election.<ref name="fearing loss"/> The Democratic Party contributed heavily to Weprin in the last weeks of the race, as Turner's odds of winning increased.<ref name="late help"/> Turner's win was publicized as a large upset victory, and made national headlines because Democrats outnumbered Republicans by 3-to-1 in the district.<ref>{{cite news|last=Honan |first=Edith |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/03/20/us-usa-politics-newyork-idUSBRE82J04220120320 |title=New York Republican wins key 3rd-party nod in Senate bid |publisher=Reuters |date=March 19, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Miller |first=Joshua |url=http://www.rollcall.com/news/bob_turner_upsets_democrat_david_weprin_new_york_special-208699-1.html |title=Bob Turner Upsets Democrat David Weprin in New York Special |publisher=Roll Call |date=September 14, 2011 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref> His win was also unexpected because his district had a large Jewish constituency (up to one quarter of registered voters are Jewish), and Turner beat Weprin, an Orthodox Jew, with a majority of the Jewish vote.<ref name="banks on"/>
Turner's campaign manager, E. O'Brien Murray, was later named 2012 GOP campaign manager of the year, by the [[American Association of Political Consultants]] for his role in the win.<ref>{{cite news|last=Katz |first=Celeste |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/blogs/dailypolitics/2012/04/bob-turner-touts-e-obrien-murray-street-cred |title=Bob Turner Touts E. O'Brien Murray Street Cred |publisher=New York Daily News |date=April 5, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref> The district is Democratic leaning with a [[Cook Partisan Voting Index]] (CPVI) of D+5.<ref name="Tomasky">{{cite news| last=Tomasky| first=Michael| date=June 7, 2011 | url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2011/06/07/anthony-weiner-the-scandal-s-congressional-consequences.html| title=How the GOP Can Take Anthony Weiner's Seat| work=[[The Daily Beast]] | accessdate=September 21, 2011}}</ref> In ''Salon'', which called Turner's win "unremarkable", it was argued that the district had been leaning rightward, as it was one of the few districts in the nation in which [[Barack Obama]] performed one point worse than [[John Kerry]] in 2004 and 12 points worse than [[Al Gore]] in 2000.<ref name="Obama lower than Kerry"/> Though Salon's claims are questioned by some as Obama won the district in 2008 by 11 points and Kerry by 12 in 2004, which does not seem to imply a strong conservative swing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.swingstateproject.com/diary/4161/|title=Swing State Project|work=swingstateproject.com|accessdate=June 4, 2015}}</ref> Further the local city council seat was easily won by a Democrat in the most recent election along with the local State Senate and Assembly seats. This included a special election for [[New York State Assembly]] on the same day as Turners election, within his congressional district, where the democrat won with 76% of the vote. Further Governor Cuomo easily won the congressional district in his run for Governor of New York.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://elections.nytimes.com/2009/results/city-council.html | work=The New York Times | title=Election 2009 | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091109185422/http://elections.nytimes.com/2009/results/city-council.html | archivedate=November 9, 2009 | df=mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/files/elections/2011/by_county/NY_State_Assembly_0913.html?SITE=AP&SECTION=POLITICS|title=News from The Associated Press|work=ap.org|accessdate=June 4, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://elections.nytimes.com/2010/results/new-york/state-legislature | work=The New York Times | title=New York State Legislature Election Results}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/politics/new-york-election-2012-results-article-1.1197541 | location=New York | work=Daily News}}</ref>
====Federal spending cuts==== One of Turner's campaign themes was fiscal recovery through cuts in federal spending.<ref name="gop hopeful"/><ref name="draws hecklers"/> He said that the federal budget needed to be cut by as much as a third,<ref name="NYTMagician"/> that capital gains taxes should be eliminated, and corporate and individual income taxes reduced.<ref name="Dailycaller"/> He opposed what Democrats said were Republican plans to privatize Medicare and Social Security and turn Medicaid into a block-grant program, reportedly at the request of former New York mayor [[Ed Koch]], who supported him.<ref name="koch endorses"/> In endorsing Turner's opponent, ''The New York Times'' said that Turner's economic plan to reduce taxes without reducing benefits for current Medicare and Social Security recipients was unrealistic. "That would take a magician, not a businessman", said the Times.<ref name="NYTMagician"/> One month before the election, Turner admitted that an op-ed he written for the ''[[National Review]]'' calling for a one third reduction in federal spending and "an end to government dependencies" was "blatant pandering" to "a particular audience".<ref name="gop hopeful"/>
During his 2011 campaign, Turner stated he came out of retirement to run for Congress "to fix what's broken and go home. End subsidies. End government dependencies. Dramatically cut the budget by 30 or 35 percent. Slash capital-gains taxes down to zero. Cut taxes across the board. The rest of America's economic healing will happen naturally as a consequence", he said.<ref name="nationalreview1"/> In 2011 he chose not to sign "the pledge," citing the need to compromise in the critical area of reducing the debt. In his 2011 campaign he cited illegal immigration as a major cause of U.S. unemployment.<ref name="loud and clear"/> To resolve the U.S. debt, he proposed eliminating the U.S Department of Agriculture and the Environmental Protection Agency and reducing the size of the Department of Education.<ref name="gop hopeful"/><ref name="draws hecklers"/>
====Tenure==== [[File:Turner Cross Bay.jpg|thumb|left|Turner at the [[Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge]], where he argued for the elimination of its tolls]] Turner was sworn in on September 15, 2011.<ref name="takes office"/> Turner was mentored by Homeland Security Chair, [[Peter T. King]] (R-NY) in his transition to his new job.<ref name="taps Weiner"/> He met with his former rival, Anthony Weiner, discussing open constituent files and issues facing the district, including noise pollution and eroding beaches.<ref name="taps Weiner"/> He had a cordial and businesslike meeting with Weiner, though the two men have been described as polar opposites.<ref name="taps Weiner"/>
Within weeks of taking office, Turner was attacked by the [[Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee]] (DCCC) for his no new tax pledge, and painted by the DCC as representing wealthy individuals and corporations rather than the average district voter.<ref name="democrats attack"/> Turner expressed support for [[hydrofracking]] in upstate New York, and would allow states to opt out of [[No Child Left Behind]].<ref name="new congressman"/> Remarking on the tenth anniversary of the war in Afghanistan, Turner said he would "leave our military commitment in Afghanistan up to the generals in the field," adding that, "If they believe the sacrifice of our soldiers continues to be necessary to prevent attacks on U.S. soil, then we have no choice but to let them finish the task."<ref name="no closure"/> Turner was an advocate for removing the tolls on the [[Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge]], and applauded Gov. Cuomo for his motions towards changing the policy.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://bobturner.house.gov/photo-gallery/congressman-bob-turner |title=Representative Robert Turner |publisher=Bobturner.house.gov |date=September 29, 2011 |accessdate=May 28, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120916150525/http://bobturner.house.gov/photo-gallery/congressman-bob-turner |archive-date=September 16, 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref>
In November 2011, a protester affiliated with the [[Occupy Wall Street]] movement shouted during Turner's ceremonial swearing-in.<ref name="protester"/><ref name="boots"/> Turner then criticized the OWS demonstrators as socialist and praised America's capitalist system as a "beacon to the world".<ref name="protester">{{cite news|url=http://www.timesledger.com/stories/2011/46/turnerinauguration_fh_2011_11_17_q.html|title=Protester crashes Turner inauguration|author=Rebecca Henely|work=TimesLedger|location=Queens|date=|accessdate=November 17, 2011}}</ref><ref name="boots">{{cite news|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/news/local/queens/take_out_the_trasher_TuMpvuv7PYzeL0vKMOjS4H|title=Ex-cop boots OWS heckler from congressman's swearing-in|author=Frank Rosario, Doug Auer and Bob Fredericks|date=November 14, 2011|work=New York Post}}</ref> Turner voted for Paul Ryan's revised [[Ryan Plan#Roadmap for America's Future|budget plan]] in 2012,<ref>{{cite web|last=Pillifant |first=Reid |url=http://www.capitalnewyork.com/article/politics/2012/03/5586797/new-york-republicans-prepare-defend-paul-ryans-budget-plan-or-not |title=New York Republicans prepare to defend Paul Ryan's budget plan, or not |publisher=Capital New York |date=March 30, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref> despite reluctance that it would privatize [[Health care reforms proposed during the Obama administration#Privatize Medicare with a voucher system|Medicare and Social Security]]. Turner promised during his campaign to protect Social Security, and explicitly said he would vote no to the Ryan plan.<ref name="opposed to Ryan Plan"/> Turner's spokesman defended his vote for the bill, saying Turner was opposed to many of its provisions, but believed it was a good starting point for negotiations because it would not be finalized without compromise with the Democratic-controlled Senate.<ref>{{cite web|last=Freedlander |first=David |url=http://www.politicker.com/2012/03/29/turner-votes-for-ryan-budget/ |title=Turner Votes For Ryan Budget, Despite Saying He Wouldn’t |publisher=Politicker |date=March 29, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref> However, Turner did suggest raising the minimum age from 65.<ref name="daily news endorses"/><ref name="juniper civic"/> [[Image:PHOTO 3.2.12 Congressman Turner Teach Act Press Conference 1 - Copy.jpg|thumb|left|Turner speaking about his proposed Teach Act of 2012, which would give a tax credit up to $5,000 for children in private or parochial schools]] Turner introduced The TEACH Act of 2012, which would provide a [[federal tax credit]] of up to $5,000 per year to families who send their children to non-public K-12 schools. Congressman Turner has said his goal with the TEACH Act is to ameliorate the “double taxation” burdening on parents paying for local school taxes and private schooling tuition.<ref>{{cite web|last=Berke |first=Ned |url=http://www.sheepsheadbites.com/2012/03/turner-pushes-bill-providing-5000-tax-credit-to-private-school-parents/ |title=Turner Pushes Bill Providing $5,000 Tax Credit To Private School Parents |publisher=Sheepshead Bay News |date=March 2, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref> His proposal received wide support from the [[Orthodox Union]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ou.org/index.php/news/article/96158/ |title=OU Commends Representative Bob Turner’s Intro of "TEACH" Act for Schools |publisher=Orthodox Union |date=March 5, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012 }}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Yeshiva congregations in Queens,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://jewishvoiceny.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=636:turner-proposes-tax-credit-for-parents&catid=102:education&Itemid=285 |title=Turner Proposes Tax Credit For Parents |publisher=The Jewish Voice |date=March 7, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref> and the [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Fraser |first=Lisa A. |url=http://www.licjournal.com/view/full_story/17772125/article-Turner-s-TEACH-Act-could-save-parents-thousands-?instance=most_viewed |title=Turner's TEACH Act could save parents thousands |publisher=LIC/Astoria Journal |date=March 7, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://thetablet.org/?p=11151 |title=Tuition Tax Credits – Local Congressman Supports Relief for Parents Who Choose Parochial Schools |publisher=The Tablet |date=March 9, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref> The Act is currently in [[House Committee on Ways and Means|committee]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/112/hr4075 |title=Tax and Education Assistance for Children (TEACH) Act of 2012 (H.R. 4075) |publisher=GovTrack.us |date= |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref>
====Committee assignments==== [[File:Turner Foreign Affairs committee.JPG|thumb|right|Turner seated at the [[House Foreign Affairs Committee]]. On foreign affairs, he supported Israel and voted to restrict the threat of a nuclear Iran]] The House Republican Steering Committee assigned Turner to three committees in the House, including '''[[United States House Committee on Foreign Affairs|Foreign Affairs]]''', '''[[United States House Committee on Veterans Affairs|Veterans Affairs]]''', and '''[[United States House Committee on Homeland Security|Homeland Security]]'''. When asked about the news, Turner said he was "very excited to be appointed to three important House committees." Rep. [[Peter T. King|Peter King]] commended Turner's involvement in homeland security, saying Turner knew that "New York is the number one target." Turner sided with the [[Scandals and allegations of the New York City Police Department#NYPD Muslim surveillance controversy|NYPD's intelligence gathering of Arab-Americans]], and supported more funding for defense.<ref>{{cite web|last=Berke |first=Ned |url=http://www.sheepsheadbites.com/2012/04/video-turner-saber-rattles-on-iran-at-manhattan-beach-neighborhood-association/ |title=Video: Turner Saber Rattles On Iran At Manhattan Beach Neighborhood Association |publisher=Sheepshead Bay News |date=April 5, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref> Upon being chosen to serve on the House Committee on Foreign Affairs, he stated, "I intend to forward my beliefs that it is in our national interest to defend our Middle East ally, Israel, and I will oppose further attempts by the U.N. to recognize a Palestinian state."<ref name="foreign affairs"/> He co-sponsored H.R. Bill 556, which condemned Iran for human rights abuses,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/112/hres556 |title=Condemning the Government of Iran for its continued persecution, imprisonment, and sentencing of Youcef Nadarkhani on the charge of apostasy. (H.Res. 556) |publisher=GovTrack.us |date= |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref> and urged Pres. Obama to challenge Iran for its nuclear armament policies<ref>{{cite web |url=http://bobturner.house.gov/press-release/congressman-turner-statement-iran%E2%80%99s-failure-cooperate-iaea |title=Congressman Turner Statement on Iran’s failure to Cooperate With IAEA |publisher=Bobturner.house.gov |date=February 22, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120926183401/http://bobturner.house.gov/press-release/congressman-turner-statement-iran%E2%80%99s-failure-cooperate-iaea |archive-date=September 26, 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref> Turner pushed for strict economic sanctions on the [[Central Bank of the Islamic Republic of Iran|Iranian Central Bank]], and criticized Sen. [[Harry Reid]] for stalling H.R. 1905, which would have allowed the U.S. to restrict Iran's trade internationally and bar U.S.-Iran diplomacy.<ref>{{cite web|last=Turner |first=Bob |url=http://www.brooklyneagle.com/articles/iran-fast-approaching-point-no-return |title=Iran: Fast Approaching the Point of No Return |publisher=Brooklyn Daily Eagle |date=January 26, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Tierney |first=Dominic |url=https://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2011/12/prepare-for-war-the-insane-plan-to-outlaw-diplomacy-with-iran/249478/ |title=Prepare for War: The Insane Plan to Outlaw Diplomacy with Iran |publisher=The Atlantic |date=December 6, 2011 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref>
''Brooklyn Daily'' opined that the assignments would not allow Turner to make use of his business experience and offered little opportunity for him to deliver on his promises of bringing "fiscal sanity" to Washington.<ref name="committee assignments">{{cite web|last=Tracy |first=Thomas |url=http://www.brooklyndaily.com/stories/2011/41/mm_turnercommittees_2011_10_14_bd.html |title=His Turner: Bob named to vets, security committees |publisher=Brooklyn Daily |date=October 13, 2011 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref> His predecessor, Anthony Weiner, had served in the '''[[United States House Committee on Energy and Commerce|Committee on Energy and Commerce]]''', which had the broadest jurisdiction of the committees.<ref name="committee assignments"/>
====Redistricting==== Following the 2010 Census, New York State lost two congressmen in its delegation, and Turner's district was split. ''Crain's New York Business'' said that Turner's win would make the New York Republican Party more likely to push for a "super Jewish" congressional district, extending the influence of Brooklyn's Orthodox Jewish community.<ref name="crains"/> Under the new congressional district lines, he would possibly have faced [[Gregory Meeks]] in a more African-American and heavily Democratic constituency; Turner was not optimistic about his chances, telling reporters, "That’s a district that really can’t be moved. That’s not a legitimate shot."<ref>{{cite web|last=Karlin |first=Rick |url=http://blog.timesunion.com/capitol/archives/121113/turner-thats-life-in-the-big-city/ |title=Capitol Confidential » Turner: ‘That’s life in the Big City’ |publisher=Blog.timesunion.com |date=March 16, 2012 |accessdate=May 28, 2012}}</ref>
===2012 U.S. Senate election=== {{Main|United States Senate election in New York, 2012}} In March 2012, he announced he would challenge Democratic incumbent U.S. Senator [[Kirsten Gillibrand]]. Turner faced attorney [[Wendy E. Long]], and Nassau County Comptroller [[George Maragos]] in a primary election to face Gillibrand. The 2012 New York State Republican convention split the endorsement among the three candidates, with enough support for each candidate to automatically appear on the ballot. Turner lost the primary election to Long on June 26, 2012.<ref name="timesledger.com"/> He additionally sought the endorsement of New York's [[New York Conservative Party|Conservative Party]], which he also lost to Long.<ref name="cpnys.org"/>
===Queens County GOP Chairman=== On March 12, 2015, Turner was named chairman of the [[Queens]] borough Republican Party.<ref>http://www.qchron.com/editions/central/bob-turner-to-head-queens-republican-party/article_6ec1ee80-c69f-11e4-a901-c76fe2c0835a.html</ref> He was endorsed for the position by New York state Republican chairman [[Edward F. Cox|Ed Cox]], and voted in unanimously.<ref>http://www.timesledger.com/stories/2015/12/goprally_tl_2015_03_20_q.html</ref>
==Personal life== Turner has been married to Peggy Turner, a foster care nurse for special needs children, for 48 years.<ref name="campaign site"/> The couple has five adult children and 13 grandchildren and resides in [[Rockaway Point, Queens]].<ref name="campaign site"/> In August 2011, Turner revealed the couple's 1994 adoption of C.J. Holmstrom, an orphan whose parents had died from AIDS.<ref name="adopted"/> C.J.'s mother, Rosemary Holmstrom, had been on daytime talk shows in the 1980s discussing the death of her husband from AIDS, and her own HIV positive status.<ref name="adopted"/><ref name="CJ"/> The Turners helped her and C.J. from that time on, adopting C.J after her death.<ref name="adopted"/><ref>A movie, [[A Mother's Prayer]], was produced in 1995 based on Rosemary's life.</ref> Turner’s home was flooded and subsequently burned to the ground during [[Hurricane Sandy]].<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/11/01/us/after-storms-destruction-halting-return-in-northeast.html?pagewanted=all&_r=0 | work=The New York Times | first=James | last=Barron | title=In Storm's Wake, Rescues, Looting, and a Rising Death Toll | date=October 31, 2012}}</ref>
