revision.comment: changed "affiliated corporation" to its subsidiary [[Cambridge Analytica]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = SCL Group | former_name = Strategic Communication Laboratories | logo = SCL Group logo.png | type = [[Private company|Private]] | industry = [[Data mining]], [[data analysis]] | founded = {{Start date and age|1990}} as Behavioural Dynamics Institute | defunct = {{end date|2018|5|1|df=y}} | founder = [[Nigel Oakes|Nigel John Oakes]] | hq_location_city = [[London]] | hq_location_country = [[United Kingdom]] | area_served = Worldwide | key_people = Nigel John Oakes
Roger Michael Gabb
[[Alexander Nix]]
Julian David Wheatland | products = | num_employees = | num_employees_year = | subsid = [[Cambridge Analytica]] | website = {{URL|https://sclgroup.cc}} }} '''SCL Group'''{{cite web|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/05514098|title=SCL GROUP LIMITED - Overview|publisher=[[Companies House]]|website=beta.companieshouse.gov.uk}} (formerly '''Strategic Communication Laboratories''') was a private [[British people|British]] behavioural research and [[strategic communication]] company.{{cite web|title=SCL group Ltd - filing history and public records|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/05514098|publisher=Companies House, UK|accessdate=23 March 2018}} In the United States, SCL has gained public recognition mainly through its subsidiary [[Cambridge Analytica]].{{Cite news|url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/cruz-campaign-paid-750000-to-psychographic-profiling-company/2015/10/19/6c83e508-743f-11e5-9cbb-790369643cf9_story.html|title = Cruz campaign paid $750,000 to ‘psychographic profiling’ company|last = Sellers|first = Frances Stead|date = 2015-10-19|newspaper = The Washington Post|language = en-US|issn = 0190-8286|access-date = 2016-03-07}} It performs [[data mining]] and [[data analysis]] on its audience. Based on results, communications will be specifically targeted to key audience groups to modify behaviour in accordance with the goal of SCL's client. The company describes itself as a "global election management agency".{{cite web|url=http://scl.cc/|title=SCL Group - Home|publisher=SCL Group}} London-based SCL was founded by [[Nigel Oakes]] who serves as its CEO.{{cite news |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2017-03-23/trump-data-gurus-leave-long-trail-of-subterfuge-dubious-dealing| title=Trump Data Gurus Leave Long Trail of Subterfuge, Dubious Dealing |website=[[Bloomberg.com]] |accessdate=3 April 2017}} On 1 May 2018, SCL Group stated that it would be closing operations due to the [[Facebook–Cambridge Analytica data scandal]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.engadget.com/2018/05/02/cambridge-analytica-is-shutting-down-following-facebook-scandal/|title=Cambridge Analytica is shutting down following Facebook scandal|last=Lumb|first=David|date=2 May 2018|work=[[Engadget]]|access-date=2 May 2018}} However, its website and staff continue to operate.{{cite web |title=SCL website |url=https://sclgroup.cc |website=https://sclgroup.cc |publisher=SCL |accessdate=6 June 2018}} SCL group is owned by its parent company SCL Elections.{{cite news |last1=Ghoshal |first1=Debjyot |title=The amazing reach of Cambridge Analytica |url=https://qz.com/1239762/cambridge-analytica-scandal-all-the-countries-where-scl-elections-claims-to-have-worked/ |accessdate=6 June 2018 |publisher=Quartz / Reuters |date=28 March 2018}} ==History== In 1990, Nigel Oakes, who had a background in TV production and [[advertising]], founded the '''Behavioural Dynamics Institute (BDI)''' as a research facility for [[strategic communication]]. The study of [[mass behavior]] and how to change it led him to establish '''Strategic Communication Laboratories''' in 1993. Oakes thought that in order to shift [[mass opinion]], academic insights as gained through psychologists and anthropologists at BDI should be applied, and would be more successful than traditional advertising methods.{{cite news| url=https://www.bloomberg.com/politics/features/2015-11-12/is-the-republican-party-s-killer-data-app-for-real-| author=[[Sasha Issenberg]] |title=Cruz-Connected Data Miner Aims to Get Inside U.S. Voters' Heads |publisher=Bloomberg| date=12 November 2015 |accessdate=2 February 2016}} BDI became a non-profit affiliate of SCL. ==Activities== After an initial commercial success, SCL expanded into military and political arenas. It became known for alleged involvement "in military [[disinformation campaign]]s to [[social media]] [[Brand management|branding]] and [[voter targeting]]".{{cite news| url= http://www.politico.com/story/2015/07/ted-cruz-donor-for-data-119813#ixzz3zR4A2d8U|author=Vogel, Kenneth P |title=Cruz partners with donor's 'psychographic' firm |publisher=Politico| date=7 July 2015 |accessdate=27 December 2015}} In 2005, “with a glitzy exhibit” at Defence and Security Equipment International ([[DSEI]]), “the United Kingdom's largest showcase for military technology”, SCL demonstrated its capacity in “[[influence operations]]”: “to help orchestrate a sophisticated campaign of mass deception” on the public of a big city like London. According to its website, SCL has participated in over 25 international political and [[electoral campaign]]s since 1994. SCL’s involvement in the political world has been primarily in the [[developing world]] where it has been used by the military and politicians to study and [[Crowd manipulation|manipulate]] [[public opinion]] and political will. It uses what have been called “psy ops” to provide insight into the thinking of the target audience. SCL claimed to be able to help foment coups.{{cite news| url= http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/dispatches/2005/09/you_cant_handle_the_truth.single.html |author=Weinberger, Sharon |author-link= Sharon Weinberger |title=You Can't Handle the Truth |publisher=Slate| date=19 September 2005 |accessdate=19 March 2018}} According to its website, SCL has influenced elections in Italy, Latvia, Ukraine, Albania, Romania, South Africa, Nigeria, Kenya, Mauritius, India, Indonesia, The Philippines,{{cite news|last1=Robles|first1=Raissa|title=How Cambridge Analytica’s parent company helped ‘man of action’ Rodrigo Duterte win the 2016 Philippines election|url=http://www.scmp.com/news/asia/southeast-asia/article/2140303/how-cambridge-analyticas-parent-company-helped-man-action|publisher=South China Morning Post|date=4 April 2018}} Thailand, Taiwan, Colombia, Antigua, St. Vincent & the Grenadines, St. Kitts & Nevis, and Trinidad & Tobago. While the company initially got involved in elections in the United Kingdom, it ceased to do so after 1997 because staff members did not exhibit the same "aloof sensibility" as with projects abroad. SCL claims that its methodology has been approved or endorsed by agencies of the [[Government of the United Kingdom]] and the [[Federal government of the United States]], among others.{{cite web|url=https://sclelections.com/|title=SCL Elections - Home|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160216065419/https://sclelections.com/|archivedate=2016-02-16|df=}} ===Cambridge Analytica=== {{main|Cambridge Analytica}} SCL formed [[Cambridge Analytica]] to participate in the election process in the United States.{{cite web | url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2017/feb/26/robert-mercer-breitbart-war-on-media-steve-bannon-donald-trump-nigel-farage|title=Robert Mercer: The big data billionaire waging war on mainstream media|publisher=The Observer|first= Carole| last=Cadwalladr |website=theguardian.com|date=26 February 2017}} It entered the U.S. market in 2012, and was involved in 44 U.S. congressional, US Senate and state-level elections in the 2014 midterm elections. In 2015 it was disclosed that the company had entered the [[Republican Party presidential primaries, 2016|Republican Party presidential primaries for the 2016]] election, primarily in support of [[Ted Cruz]]. CA is heavily funded by hedge-fund billionaire [[Robert Mercer (businessman)|Robert Mercer]], a major supporter of Cruz and then [[Donald Trump]], and is now under investigation by both the UK and the US governments. ===Emerdata Limited=== Emerdata Limited was established in August 2017, by many of the people involved in [[Cambridge Analytica]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.metro.us/news/the-big-stories/cambridge-analytica-backers-new-data-company-emerdata|title=Backers of Cambridge Analytica have set up new data company: Report|date=2018-03-21|work=Metro US|access-date=2018-05-02|language=en}}{{Cite web|url=https://medium.com/@wsiegelman/cambridge-analytica-executives-created-a-company-in-2017-with-the-executive-director-deputy-b803f27f84a2|title=Cambridge Analytica executives created a company with the Executive Director & Deputy Chairman of…|last=Siegelman|first=Wendy|date=2018-03-19|website=Medium|access-date=2018-05-02}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/may/02/cambridge-analytica-closing-down-after-facebook-row-reports-say|title=Cambridge Analytica closing after Facebook data harvesting scandal|last=Solon|first=Olivia|last2=Laughland|first2=Oliver|date=2018-05-02|website=the Guardian|language=en|access-date=2018-05-03}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/may/05/cambridge-analytica-scl-group-new-companies-names|title=Cambridge Analytica is dead – but its obscure network is alive and well|last=Siegelman|first=Wendy|date=2018-05-05|website=the Guardian|language=en|access-date=2018-08-13}} Emerdata was established in 2017 by the chief data officer and chairman of Cambridge Analytica's parent company SCL Group, which closed operations on the 1 May 2018.{{Cite news|url=https://www.engadget.com/2018/05/02/cambridge-analytica-is-shutting-down-following-facebook-scandal/|title=Cambridge Analytica is shutting down following Facebook scandal|work=Engadget|access-date=2018-05-03|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2018/may/02/cambridge-analytica-closure-questions-and-answers|title=Cambridge Analytica closure – questions and answers|last=Waterson|first=Jim|date=2018-05-02|website=the Guardian|language=en|access-date=2018-05-03}}{{Cite news|url=http://uk.businessinsider.com/cambridge-analytica-failed-to-sell-itself-to-18000-buyers-2018-7?IR=T|title=Cambridge Analytica tried to sell itself to 18,000 buyers — but received just 4 paltry offers|work=Business Insider|access-date=2018-08-13|language=en}} Its headquarters in London is in the same building as Cambridge Analytica.{{Cite news|url=https://thinkprogress.org/is-cambridge-analytica-really-shutting-down-3618ac78eacb/|title=Is Cambridge Analytica really shutting down?|access-date=2018-05-02|language=en-US}} Emerdata's board of directors included [[Frontier Services Group]] officer [[Johnson Chun Shun Ko]], Cambridge Analytica investor [[Rebekah Mercer]],{{Cite news|url=http://www.newsweek.com/what-emerdata-scl-group-executives-flee-new-firm-and-its-registered-office-909334|title=As Cambridge Analytica shuts, directors surface in new firm, Emerdata|date=2018-05-03|work=Newsweek|access-date=2018-05-03|language=en}} and Cambridge Analytica CEO [[Alexander Nix]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/cambridge-analytica-close-down-following-facebook-data-scandal-n870831|title=Data analytics firm engulfed in Facebook's privacy scandal closes down|work=NBC News|access-date=2018-05-02|language=en-US}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.fr/us/cambridge-analytica-executives-and-mercer-family-launch-emerdata-2018-3|title=The power players behind Cambridge Analytica have set up a mysterious new data company|website=Business Insider France|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-05-02}}{{Cite web|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/officers/YEplkqBMfc6Rp3dbPs57pN3aqO4/appointments|title=Alexander James Ashburner NIX - Personal Appointments (free information from Companies House)|website=beta.companieshouse.gov.uk|language=en|access-date=2018-05-02}}{{Cite web|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/10911848/officers|title=EMERDATA LIMITED - Officers (free information from Companies House)|website=beta.companieshouse.gov.uk|language=en|access-date=2018-05-03}} In January 2018, Emerdata reportedly raised $19 million from international investors. Emerdata was widely discussed in the news media. It was portrayed as a potential successor to Cambridge Analytica. In May 2018, Nigel Oakes, founder of the SCL Group, Cambridge Analytica's British affiliate, acknowledged that Emerdata's intent had been to acquire Cambridge Analytica and SCL, but said that these plans had been abandoned and that Emerdata and its partly-owned subsidiary Firecrest Technologies Ltd., which had been set up by former Cambridge Analytica CEO [[Alexander Nix]], would be wound down. ===Board of directors=== As of March 2018, the company had four directors, namely Roger Michael Gabb, [[Alexander Nix]], Nigel John Oakes and Julian David Wheatland.{{cite web|title=List of officers - SGL|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/05514098/officers|publisher=Companies house|accessdate=23 March 2018}} The company was first [[Incorporation (business)|incorporated]] at [[Companies House]] on 20 July 2005 as Strategic Communication Laboratories Limited, using the [[shell company]] registrar SDG registrars limited which acts on behalf of nearly 4500 companies.{{cite web|title=Company information - SDG registrars limited|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/officers/gC8nSYuAaf2UAkS6Wzz2O9jKI5g/appointments|publisher=Companies house, UK|accessdate=23 March 2018}} ==See also== *[[Microtargeting]] *[[Psychographics]] ==References== {{reflist|refs= {{cite web|url=http://uk.businessinsider.com/cambridge-analytica-executives-and-mercer-family-launch-emerdata-2018-3|title=The power players behind Cambridge Analytica have set up a mysterious new data company|publisher=''Business Insider''}} {{cite web|url=https://www.businessinsider.nl/cambridge-analytica-could-rebrand-emerdata-2018-5/|title=The Cambridge Analytica power players set up a mysterious new data firm — and they could use it for a 'Blackwater-style' rebrand|date=3 May 2018|publisher=''Business Insider''}} {{cite web|url=http://uk.businessinsider.com/alexander-nix-allegedly-took-8-million-cambridge-analytica-2018-6|title=Cambridge Analytica's CEO allegedly took $8 million from the firm before its closure|publisher=''Business Insider''}} {{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2018-05-08/cambridge-analytica-won-t-be-revived-under-new-company-name|title=Terms of Service Violation|website=www.bloomberg.com}} {{Cite web|url=https://boingboing.net/2018/05/02/transparent-ploy.html|title=Cambridge Analytica is out of business, but its heavy hitters have reopened under a new name / Boing Boing|website=boingboing.net|language=en-US|access-date=2018-05-03}} {{cite web|url=https://www.newsweek.com/what-emerdata-scl-group-executives-flee-new-firm-and-its-registered-office-909334|title=As Cambridge Analytica shuts, directors surface in new firm, Emerdata|date=3 May 2018|publisher=''Newsweek''}} {{Cite news|url=https://www.theregister.co.uk/2018/05/02/cambridge_analytica_shutdown/|title=Cambridge Analytica dismantled for good? Nope: it's just changing its name to Emerdata|access-date=2018-05-02|language=en}} }} ==External links== * [https://sclgroup.cc/home Strategic Communication Laboratories] * [http://www.bdinstitute.org/ Behavioural Dynamics Institute] {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2018}} [[Category:Consulting firms]] [[Category:1990 establishments in England]] [[Category:2018 disestablishments in England]] [[Category:Companies based in London]] [[Category:Consulting firms established in 1990]] [[Category:Consulting firms disestablished in 2018]] [[Category:Consulting firms of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Conglomerate companies established in 1993]] [[Category:Conglomerate companies disestablished in 2018]] [[Category:Facebook]]

revision.comment: Stub removal. [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Stub sorting|You can help!]]
revision.text:
'''Saif Durbar''' is an Indian-Pakistani businessman, investor and property dealer.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/uk-firms-team-up-in-pound7bn-saudi-homes-deal-srp5r2mdvhv|title=UK firms team up in £7bn Saudi homes deal|last=Davey|first=By Jenny|date=2005-10-12|work=The Times|access-date=2018-06-27|language=en|issn=0140-0460}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://la.indymedia.org/news/2009/09/230192.php|title=Saif Durbar - Man of the Hour! : LA IMC|website=la.indymedia.org|access-date=2018-06-27}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.scoop.it/t/pz-media-inc-1/p/4010091245/2013/10/29/saif-durbar-celebrates-20-years-in-african-busines|title=Saif Durbar Celebrates 20 Years in African Busines {{!}} PZ Media Inc|website=Scoop.it|access-date=2018-06-27}}</ref> He is a former principal adviser of the presidents of the [[Central African Republic]] [[Ange-Félix Patassé|Ange Felix Patasse]] and [[François Bozizé]], and a former Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs in the Central African Republic.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.africaintelligence.com/ama/businessmen/2014/09/30/saif-durbar,108040462-art|title=UNITED KINGDOM : Saif Durbar|date=2014-09-30|work=Africa Mining Intelligence|access-date=2018-06-27|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=http://www.parismatch.com/Actu/Economie/Affaire-Areva-L-homme-qui-en-sait-trop-565335|title=Affaire Areva - L’homme qui en sait trop|access-date=2018-06-27|language=fr}}</ref>
== Life and career == Saif Durbar was born in 1962 in [[Gujarat]], India, close to the [[Pakistan]] border.<ref name=":3" /><ref name=":4">{{Cite news|url=http://www.jeuneafrique.com/mag/431591/politique/proche-de-mobutu-bozize-conde-saifee-durbar-businessman-discret/|title=Proche de Mobutu, Bozizé, Condé… Qui est Saifee Durbar, ce businessman discret ? – JeuneAfrique.com|date=2017-05-08|work=JeuneAfrique.com|access-date=2018-06-27|language=fr-FR}}</ref> His family remained close to the British after decolonisation, and was also connected to Gulf monarchies. Durbar is the grandson of one of the last nawab. His father owns factories of plastics, textiles and steel.<ref name=":4" /> After studying in England and then in Pakistan, Durbar joined the family business prior to starting his own business in 1987. It involved import, export, bond trading and banking.<ref name=":4" /> In 1995 after the loss of nearly a billion dollars he branched out into mining and investments in Africa and started property development with large capitalization.<ref name=":0" />
In 1993, he started working in Africa, developing businesses in infrastructure and real estate in [[Zaire]] until the fall of Mobutu in 1997. He continued in Central African Republic, creating businesses in mining and bringing international investors to the region. It made him an economic adviser to president Ange Felix Patasse whom he represented at the [[United Nations]].<ref name=":4" /><ref name=":5">{{Cite news|url=http://www.jeuneafrique.com/204960/politique/un-ministre-en-cavale/|title=Un ministre en cavale – JeuneAfrique.com|date=2009-02-23|work=JeuneAfrique.com|access-date=2018-06-27|language=fr-FR}}</ref>
In 2006, the became an advisor to president François Bozizé, and later in 2009 his deputy foreign minister.<ref name=":6">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nouvelobs.com/economie/20140605.OBS9633/exclusif-la-dcri-a-enquete-des-2009-sur-le-rachat-d-uramin-par-areva.html|title=EXCLUSIF. "La DCRI a enquêté dès 2009 sur le rachat d'Uramin par Areva"|work=L'Obs|access-date=2018-06-27|language=fr-FR}}</ref><ref name=":3" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.jeuneafrique.com/133651/politique/centrafrique-vrais-papiers-faux-diplomates/|title=Centrafrique : vrais papiers, faux diplomates – JeuneAfrique.com|date=2014-04-30|work=JeuneAfrique.com|access-date=2018-06-27|language=fr-FR}}</ref>
Saif Durbar is the founder and CEO of Girc, Bridge Africa Counselage, and founder of philanthropic organisation Kutamani, which provides educational tools for students in Africa.<ref name=":2" />
He started a property fund and was involved in a few large property deals in [[Great Britain|Britain]] and [[Europe]], including [[Southern France]]. He also took part in setting up the Saudi Construction Group. Together with [[Paul Blomfield|Paul Bloomfield]] and Sheikh Faisal al-Sharif, chairman of DGI, they announced in 2009 the partnership with [[Lend Lease Project Management & Construction|Bovis Lend Lease]] and [[Foster and Partners|Foster & Partners]] on a $13 billion (£7.4 billion) plan to develop a new city of 750,000 new homes in [[Saudi Arabia]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.indymedia.org.uk/en/2009/08/436833.html|title=Bovis Lend Lease and Saifee Dubar: The Saudi Experiment - UK Indymedia|website=www.indymedia.org.uk|language=en|access-date=2018-06-27}}</ref><ref name=":0" />
== Controversies == Durbar was the adviser of Bozize, when the Canadian company [[:fr:UraMin|Uramin]] acquired 90% of the [[Bakouma]] uranium mine.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.lecho.be/dossier/choixredac/comment-areva-a-transforme-uramin-en-gouffre-financier/9869588.html|title=Comment Areva a transformé UraMin en gouffre financier|date=2017-03-06|work=L'Echo|access-date=2018-06-27|language=fr}}</ref>
In 2007, the French state-owned [[nuclear power]] company [[Orano|Areva]] purchased Uramin and its mines for 1.8 billion euros. According to Durbar, the acquisition took place without notification of change of ownership to the CAR government who owned 15% of Uramin, Durbar got the government to appoint lawyers and request justification for the transaction. The mines were later proved unusable for their low uranium concentration and expensive logistics, which Areva’s CEO [[Anne Lauvergeon]] was aware of. This brought out allegations of a possible corruption operation.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.jeuneafrique.com/mag/476433/culture/quand-la-litterature-nous-eclaire-sur-le-trafic-duranium-entre-la-france-et-lafrique/|title=Quand la littérature nous éclaire sur le trafic d’uranium entre la France et l’Afrique – JeuneAfrique.com|date=2017-10-02|work=JeuneAfrique.com|access-date=2018-06-27|language=fr-FR}}</ref><ref name=":6" /><ref name=":4" /><ref name=":6" />
In 2014, Vincent Crouzet published a book ‘Radioactive’ about the Uramin scandal with Saif Durbar as one of the main protagonists and a key witness.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nouvelobs.com/rue89/rue89-temoignage/20140606.RUE4288/affaire-uramin-comment-j-ai-ete-plonge-dans-ce-dossier-radioactif.html|title=Affaire UraMin : comment j’ai été plongé dans ce dossier radioactif|work=L'Obs|access-date=2018-06-27|language=fr-FR}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.parismatch.com/Culture/Livres/Affaire-Areva-Un-ecrivain-entendu-par-la-Brigade-financiere-570540|title=Affaire Areva - Un écrivain entendu par la Brigade financière|access-date=2018-06-27|language=fr}}</ref><ref name=":7">{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/1033442203|title=Radioactif|last=Vincent.|first=Crouzet,|date=2014|publisher=Belfond|isbn=9782714456526|location=Paris|oclc=1033442203}}</ref>
In August 2007, the French government issued a warrant against Durbar following his conviction on appeal for fraud on a 1995 case, a month after the CAR government issued a notice to Areva for justification.<ref name=":4" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.franceinter.fr/justice/exclusif-affaire-uramin-les-preuves-de-l-escroquerie-seraient-a-monaco|title=EXCLUSIF {{!}} Affaire UraMin : les preuves de l’escroquerie seraient à Monaco|last=Monin|first=Jacques|date=2017-01-28|work=France Inter|access-date=2018-06-27|language=fr-FR}}</ref><ref name=":7" /><ref name=":6" />
In October 2008 the [[United States|US]] ambassador to [[Bangui]] reported France’s desire “to limit the influence of Saiffee Durbar, including by using the legal proceedings against him”. To protect Durbar, Bozize appointed him Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, offering him diplomatic immunity. Following pressure from [[France]] he left the position. At the end of 2009, after his resignation as Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, he went to France to defend himself and to negotiate his extradition. After a three-month stay in the VIP the Sante district in Paris, he was placed on probation for six months under house arrest in a [[Paris]] apartment. When the probation period was over, in September 2010 he left France. <ref name=":4" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.immobilierfr.org/journal-immobilier/actualite_economique_finance_immobiliere/actualite_economique_immobiliere/saif_durbar_s_explique_et_accuse_je_suis_un_probl_me_pour_la_fra.html|title=Immobilier France: location vente appartements immobilier, agence immobiliere, credit immobilier - Saif Durbar s’explique et accuse: je suis un problème pour la France !|website=www.immobilierfr.org|language=fr-FR|access-date=2018-06-27}}</ref><ref name=":5" /><ref name=":1" />
==See also== *[[Jan Bonde Nielsen]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Durbar, Saif}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Central African Republic businesspeople]] [[Category:Fraudsters]] [[Category:Central African Republic politicians]]

page.title: Sexual harassment in the workplace in the United States

revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2016}}
'''Sexual harassment in the workplace''' in [[US labor law]] has been considered a form of [[sex discrimination|discrimination on the basis of sex]] in the United States since the mid-1970s.<ref name="mcelroy">{{cite web|url=http://www.wendymcelroy.com/ifeminists/2004/1027.html|title=The Sad Evolution of Sexual Harassment|last1=McElroy|first1=Wendy|date=27 October 2004|website=iFeminists.com|accessdate=15 August 2017}}</ref><ref name="Siegel">{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=IhYip0PqV4EC&pg=PA8&dq=lin+farley#v=onepage&q=lin%20farley&f=false|title=Directions in Sexual Harassment Law|last1=MacKinnon|first1=Catharine A.|last2=Siegel|first2=Reva I.|publisher=Yale University|year=2004|isbn=0-300-09800-6|page=8}}</ref> There are two forms of sexual harassment recognized by United States law: [[Sexual harassment#Quid pro quo sexual harassment|quid pro quo sexual harassment]] (requiring an employee to tolerate sexual harassment to keep their job, receive a tangible benefit, or avoid punishment) and behavior that creates a [[hostile work environment]] (persistent sexual behavior that unreasonably interferes with an employee's ability to work). It has been noted that a number of the early sexual harassment cases were brought by [[African Americans|African American]] women and girls.
== History == The term "sexual harassment" was coined and popularized by [[Lin Farley]] in 1975, based on a pattern she recognized during a 1974 [[Cornell University]] class she taught on women and work.<ref name="Siegel" /> It's been noted that a number of the original sexual harassment cases were on behalf of black women and girls.<ref name=":1">{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=EIM88_WwJCsC&pg=PA431&lpg=PA431&dq=williams+v.+saxbe+appeal&source=bl&ots=yatO7SUcs9&sig=EEDntusmtqcqnq4GMPSeAHCXKgs&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjM3bO98dvcAhXVCTQIHbMMDM84ChDoATAAegQIABAB#v=onepage&q=williams%20v.%20saxbe%20appeal&f=false|title=Law, Gender, and Injustice: A Legal History of U.S. Women|last=Hoff|first=Joan|date=1994-04-01|publisher=NYU Press|year=|isbn=9780814744864|location=|pages=431|language=en}}</ref>
United States law recognizes two forms of sexual harassment:<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.expertlaw.com/library/employment/sexual_harassment.html|title=Sexual Harassment Law|last1=Larson|first1=Aaron|date=10 January 2017|website=ExpertLaw|publisher=ExpertLaw.com|accessdate=15 August 2017}}</ref>
*'''[[Sexual harassment#Quid pro quo sexual harassment|Quid pro quo sexual harassment]]''': an employee is required to tolerate sexual harassment in exchange for employment, a raise or job benefit, or promotion. *'''[[Hostile work environment]]''': sexual harassment in the workplace results in an offensive work environment or unreasonably interferes an employee's work performance.
=== Civil Rights Act of 1964 === In the US, the [[Civil Rights Act of 1964]] prohibits [[employment discrimination]] based on [[Race (classification of human beings)|race]], sex, color, [[national origin]] or religion. Initially only intended to combat sexual harassment of women, (42 U.S.C. § 2000e-2) the prohibition of [[sex discrimination]] covers both females and males. This discrimination occurs when the sex of the worker is made as a condition of employment (i.e. all female waitpersons or male carpenters) or where this is a job requirement that does not mention sex but ends up preventing many more persons of one sex than the other from the job (such as height and weight limits). This act only applies to employers with 15 or more employees.<ref>{{cite web|title=Sexual Harassment|url=https://www.eeoc.gov/laws/types/sexual_harassment.cfm|website=EEOC|publisher=U.S. Equal Opportunity Commission|accessdate=15 August 2017}}</ref>
=== Equal Employment Opportunity Commission regulations (1980) === In 1980, the [[Equal Employment Opportunity Commission]] (EEOC) issued regulations defining sexual harassment and stating it was a form of sex discrimination prohibited by the Civil Rights Act of 1964.
=== Civil Rights Act of 1991 === The [[Civil Rights Act of 1991]] added provisions to Title VII protections including expanding the rights of women to sue and collect compensatory and punitive [[damages]] for sexual discrimination or harassment
=== Case Law === ==== ''Barnes v Train'' (1974) ==== ''[[Barnes v. Train]]'' (1974) is commonly viewed as the first sexual harassment case in America, even though the term "sexual harassment" was not used.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/2004/10/27/sad-evolution-sexual-harassment.html|title=The Sad Evolution of Sexual Harassment|date=2004-10-27|work=Fox News|access-date=2018-08-08|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":1" /> Paulette Barnes, an African American woman, was a payroll clerk who worked for the [[United States Environmental Protection Agency|Environmental Protection Agency]]. She brought the case after losing her job for refusing the advances of a male supervisor.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite journal|last=Peirce|first=Michelle Ridgeway|date=1989|title=Sexual Harassment and Title VII: A Better Solution|url=http://lawdigitalcommons.bc.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1897&context=bclr|journal=Boston College Law Review, Volume 30, Issue 4, Number 4|doi=|pmid=|access-date=}}</ref> The case was dismissed, but was appealed in ''Barnes v Costle'' (1977).<ref name=":1" />
==== ''Williams v. Saxbe'' (1976) ==== In 1976, ''[[Williams v. Saxbe]]'' was the first case in a [[United States district court|U.S. District Court]] to establish that [[quid pro quo]] sexual harassment constitutes sex discrimination under the [[Civil Rights Act of 1964]]. A male supervisor was found to have retaliated against [[Diane R. Williams]] by firing her after she refused to have sex with him. The court found that it was form of sex discrimination when a condition of employment is to submit to the sexual advances of a superior. Additionally, there was evidence that other female employees had been subjected to similar conditions. It was ruled that William B. Saxbe had only required women to submit to his advances, which created an artificial barrier to employment for one gender but not the other.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/FSupp/413/654/1660985/|title=Williams v. Saxbe, 413 F. Supp. 654 (D.D.C. 1976)|work=Justia Law|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2014-12-04/sexual-harassment-naming-it-paved-the-way-to-legal-victories|title=How Two Legal Cases Established Sexual Harassment as a Civil Rights Violation|work=Bloomberg.com|access-date=2018-08-07|language=en}}</ref>
''Williams v Saxbe'' established a clear-cut type of sexual harassment, [[quid pro quo]], and was the first to establish it in a [[United States district court|U.S. District Court]]. In response to the findings of this case, several earlier decisions against sex discrimination in lower courts were reversed on appeal, including ''Barnes v Train.'' <ref name=":1" />
==== ''Barnes v. Costle'' (1977) ==== Although ''[[Barnes v. Train]]'' (1974) was initially dismissed, Paulette Barnes won on appeal in ''Barnes v. Costle'' (1977). During this case, the [[District of Columbia Court of Appeals]] ruled it was sex discrimination for a woman to suffer tangible employment losses (for example losing her job) for refusing to submit to requests for sexual favors. The appeals ruling was based in part on the ''Williams v. Saxbe'' (1976) decision.<ref name=":12">{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=EIM88_WwJCsC&pg=PA431&lpg=PA431&dq=williams+v.+saxbe+appeal&source=bl&ots=yatO7SUcs9&sig=EEDntusmtqcqnq4GMPSeAHCXKgs&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjM3bO98dvcAhXVCTQIHbMMDM84ChDoATAAegQIABAB#v=onepage&q=williams%20v.%20saxbe%20appeal&f=false|title=Law, Gender, and Injustice: A Legal History of U.S. Women|last=Hoff|first=Joan|date=1994-04-01|publisher=NYU Press|year=|isbn=9780814744864|location=|pages=431-432|language=en}}</ref> The court also found that companies are liable for not stopping sexual harassment if they know it is being conducted by supervisors.<ref name=":12" /> As part of the ruling of ''Barnes v. Costle,'' Barnes received around $18,000 for back pay and the loss of promotions.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.wenzelfenton.com/blog/2018/01/01/history-sexual-harassment-laws-united-states/|title=History of Sexual Harassment Laws in the United States|date=2018-01-01|work=Wenzel Fenton Cabassa, P.A.|access-date=2018-08-09|language=en-US}}</ref>
==== ''Meritor Savings Bank v. Vinson'' (1986) ==== In the 1986 case of ''[[Meritor Savings Bank v. Vinson]]'', the Supreme Court first recognized "sexual harassment" as a violation of Title VII, established the standards for analyzing whether the conduct was welcome and levels of employer [[legal liability|liability]], and that speech or conduct in itself can create a "[[hostile environment sexual harassment|hostile environment]]".<ref>{{caselaw source |case=''Meritor Savings Bank v. Vinson'', 477 U.S. 57 (1986) |findlaw=http://caselaw.lp.findlaw.com/scripts/getcase.pl?navby=CASE&court=US&vol=477&page=57 |justia=http://supreme.justia.com/us/477/57/case.html}}</ref> This case filed by Mechelle Vinson ruled that the sexual conduct between the subordinate and supervisor could not be deemed voluntary due to the hierarchical relationship between the two positions in the workplace.<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/53284947|title=Sexual harassment and the law : the Mechelle Vinson case|last=1946-|first=Cochran, Augustus B.,|date=2004|publisher=University Press of Kansas|isbn=0700613234|location=Lawrence, Kan.|oclc=53284947}}</ref> Following the ruling of Meritor Savings Bank v. Vinson, reported sexual harassment cases grew from 10 cases being registered by the EEOC per year before 1896 to 624 case being reported in the subsequent following year.<ref name=":0" /> This number of reported cases to the EEOC rose to 2,217 in 1990 and then 4,626 by 1995.<ref name=":0" />
==== ''Ellison v. Brady'' (1991) ==== The case of ''Ellison v. Brady'' resulted in rejecting the [[reasonable person]] standard in favor of the "reasonable woman standard" which allowed for cases to be analyzed from the perspective of the complainant and not the defendant.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Profio|first1=Debra A.|title=Ellison v. Brady: Finally, a Woman's Perspective|journal=UCLA Women's Law Journal|date=1992|volume=2|issue=0|page=249|url=http://escholarship.org/uc/item/3206643c|accessdate=15 August 2017}}</ref>
==== ''Jenson v. Eveleth Taconite Co.'' (1991) ==== Also in 1991, ''[[Jenson v. Eveleth Taconite Co.]]'' became the first sexual harassment case to be given [[class action]] status paving the way for others.
Seven years later, in 1998, through that same case, new precedents were established that increased the limits on the "[[Discovery (law)|discovery]]" process in sexual harassment cases, that then allowed psychological injuries from the [[litigation]] process to be included in assessing damages awards.
==== ''Faragher v. City of Boca Raton, Florida'', and ''Burlington v. Ellerth'' (1998) ==== In the same year, the courts concluded in ''Faragher v. City of Boca Raton, Florida'', and ''[[Burlington v. Ellerth]]'', that employers are liable for harassment by their employees.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://caselaw.lp.findlaw.com/scripts/getcase.pl?court=us&vol=000&invol=97-282 |title=U.S Supreme Court: Beth Ann Faragher, petitioner v. City of Boca Raton |publisher=FindLaw |date=June 26, 1998 |accessdate=2012-10-07}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://caselaw.lp.findlaw.com/scripts/getcase.pl?court=us&vol=000&invol=97-569 |title=U.S. Supreme Court: Burlington Industries, Inc. v. Ellerth |publisher=FindLaw |date=June 26, 1998 |accessdate=2012-10-07}}</ref>
==== ''Oncale v. Sundowner Offshore Services (1998)'' ==== Moreover, ''[[Oncale v. Sundowner Offshore Services]]'' set the precedent for same-sex harassment, and sexual harassment without motivation of "sexual desire", stating that any discrimination based on sex is actionable so long as it places the victim in an objectively disadvantageous working condition, regardless of the gender of either the victim, or the harasser.
==== ''Burlington Northern & Santa Fe Railway Co. v. White'' (2006) ==== In the 2006 case of ''[[Burlington Northern & Santa Fe Railway Co. v. White]]'', the standard for retaliation against a sexual harassment complainant was revised to include any adverse employment decision or treatment that would be likely to dissuade a "reasonable worker" from making or supporting a charge of discrimination.
==== ''Reeves v. C.H. Robinson Worldwide, Inc.'' (2010) ==== The 2010 case, [[Reeves v. C.H. Robinson Worldwide, Inc.|''Reeves v. C.H. Robinson Worldwide, Inc.'']] ruled that a hostile work environment can be created in a workplace where sexually explicit language and pornography are present.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Conte|first1=Alba|title=Sexual Harassment in the Workplace|date=2010|publisher=Wolters Kluwer|isbn=9780735597655|pages=3–278|edition=4}}</ref> A [[Hostile work environment|hostile workplace]] may exist based upon the treatment of employees as a group, even if it is not targeted at any particular employee.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Hegar|first1=Kathryn W.|title=Modern Human Relations at Work|date=2012|publisher=Cengage Learning|isbn=0538481064|page=34|edition=11}}</ref>
== Prevalence == During 2007 alone, the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission and related state agencies received 12,510 new charges of sexual harassment on the job.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kmblegal.com/index.php/160/Sexual_Harassment_Law_A_Brief_Introduction_for_New_Practitioners|title=Sexual Harassment Law: A Brief Introduction for New Practitioners|last=Marshall|first=David|author2=Andronici, Justine|date=October 23, 2008|publisher=Katz, Marshall & Banks|accessdate=March 18, 2011}}</ref>
From 2010 through 2016, men made approximately 17% of sexual harassment complaints filed with the EEOC.<ref>{{cite web|title=Charges Alleging Sex-Based Harassment (Charges filed with EEOC) FY 2010 - FY 2016|url=https://www.eeoc.gov/eeoc/statistics/enforcement/sexual_harassment_new.cfm|website=Equal Employment Opportunity Commission|accessdate=15 August 2017}}</ref>
In a 2017 MSN poll it was found that 31% of people in the U.S have been sexually harassed in the workplace; 45% of women said they were sexually harassed and 15% percent of men said they were.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/sexual-harassment-affects-nearly-everyone-2017-11|title=Sexual harassment isn't a Hollywood, tech, or comedy world issue — in fact, it affects everyone|last=Gillett|first=Rachel|date=2017-11-10|work=Business Insider|access-date=2017-11-23|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}}</ref>
===Sexual harassment in government===
The California legislature in Sacramento is known to have paid at least $850,000 in sexual harassment settlements in the period 1996-2017, though the [[New York Times]] notes often settlements are unknown to the public because of the terms of the settlements themselves.<ref>{{cite news|last1=JESS BIDGOOD|last2=MIRIAM JORDAN|last3=ADAM NAGOURNEY|title=Sexual Misconduct in California’s Capitol Is Difficult to Escape|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/29/us/sacramento-sexual-harassment-california.html?smid=tw-nytimes&smtyp=cur&_r=0|accessdate=30 October 2017|work=The New York Times|date=29 October 2017|quote=many harassment cases disappear into the court system, where the outcomes are often sealed as women sign nondisclosure agreements. Still, at least $850,000 has been paid out in court settlements}}</ref> The U.S. Congress paid $17 million between the 1990s and 2017 in settlements for sexual harassment and for discrimination.<ref>{{cite news|last1=MJ Lee, Sunlen Serfaty and Juana Summers|title=Congress paid out $17 million in settlements. Here's why we know so little about that money.|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2017/11/16/politics/settlements-congress-sexual-harassment/index.html|accessdate=13 December 2017|work=CNN|quote=one figure has emerged: the total that the Office of Compliance, the office that handles harassment complaints, has paid to victims. On Thursday, the Office of Compliance released additional information indicating that it has paid victims more than $17 million since its creation in the 1990s. That includes all settlements, not just related to sexual harassment, but also discrimination and other cases.}}</ref>
== See also == {{Slist employment equality}} *[[US labor law]] * [[Sexual harassment]] * [[Hostile work environment]] * [[Sex discrimination]]
== References == {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Sexual harassment in the United States| ]] [[Category:Labour law]] [[Category:Working conditions]] [[Category:Workplace bullying]] [[Category:United States labor law]] [[Category:Sexual harassment]]

{{About|the Irish banker|the New Zealand rugby player|Sean Fitzpatrick}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Seán FitzPatrick | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1948|5|25}} | birth_place = | death_date = <!-- {{death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | death_place = | nationality = Irish | other_names = | known_for = Chairman of [[Anglo Irish Bank]] | occupation = }} '''Seán FitzPatrick''' (born 25 May 1948) was former chairman of [[Anglo Irish Bank]] until he resigned in December 2008 amid [[Anglo Irish Bank hidden loans controversy|mounting revelations over hidden loans]].<ref>Sean FitzPatrick Anlgo Irish Bank loan book http://www.sneachta.org/index.php?title=Sean_FitzPatrick</ref> The scandal precipitated a collapse of the bank's share price which in turn led to its [[nationalisation]] on 21 January 2009.
In an [[RTÉ Radio 1]] interview on ''[[The Marian Finucane Show]]'' in October 2008, FitzPatrick denied critics' charges that the bank had been reckless in making too many big loans to property developers as Ireland's [[property bubble]] grew.<ref>{{cite video|people=[[Marian Finucane]]; Sean FitzPatrick|date=October 2008|title=Sean FitzPatrick on "The Marian Finucane Show"|url=http://www.rte.ie/podcasts/2008/pc/pod-v-071008-37m24s-marian.mp3|format=[[MP3]]|medium=Radio Broadcast|publisher=[[RTÉ Radio 1]]|location=[[Donnybrook, Dublin]]|accessdate=18 March 2010}}</ref> While saying he was grateful for the state's help, he refused to offer taxpayers an apology, saying {{quote|The cause of our problems are global, so I can't say sorry with any degree of sincerity and decency. But I can say thank you.<ref>{{cite news|last=Douglas |first=Lucy |title=Boom, bust, bailout |url=http://www.bme.eu.com/article/Boom-bust-bailout/ |accessdate=28 June 2013 |newspaper=Business Management Magazine |year=2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110511081014/http://www.bme.eu.com/article/Boom-bust-bailout/ |archivedate=11 May 2011 |df= }}</ref>}} FitzPatrick addressed the government in another speech on the same day and recommended cutting spending on what he called the "[[Sacred cow (idiom)|sacred cows]]" of Irish society: children, the elderly and health care.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.usatoday.com/money/world/2009-01-28-sean-fitzpatrick-irish-bank_N.htm | work=USA Today | first=David J. | last=Lynch | title=Irish stand united in hatred of banker Sean FitzPatrick | date=30 January 2009}}</ref> FitzPatrick was declared [[Bankruptcy in the Republic of Ireland|bankrupt]] on 12 July 2010.<ref>[http://www.rte.ie/news/2010/0712/anglo.html "FitzPatrick due to be declared bankrupt"]. 12 July 2010.</ref>
== Early life == He was born in [[County Wicklow]], [[Ireland]]. His father was a small farmer and his mother was a [[civil servant]] who left the workforce to raise her children.<ref name="lunchtime">{{cite news|title=Implosion of a legend in his own lunchtime|url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/implosion-of-a-legend-in-his-own-lunchtime-26642764.html|accessdate=24 February 2016|work=[[Irish Independent]]|publisher=[[Independent News & Media]]|date=March 21, 2010}}</ref> FitzPatrick's only sibling, his older sister, [[Joyce O'Connor|Joyce]], would go on to become the sixth [[President of National College of Ireland]].<ref name="docklands">{{cite news|title=Lifting a lid on Anglo’s links to the docklands|url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/lifting-a-lid-on-anglos-links-to-the-docklands-26514005.html|accessdate=24 February 2016|work=[[Irish Independent]]|publisher=[[Independent News & Media]]|date=February 15, 2010}}</ref> FitzPatrick was educated locally at [[Presentation College, Bray]]. Following this he attended [[University College Dublin]].<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/bankruptcy-hasnt-curbed-luxury-lifestyle-of-outsider-sean-fitzpatrick-3179760.html | work=Irish Independent | title=Bankruptcy hasn't curbed luxury lifestyle of 'outsider' Sean FitzPatrick | date=2 December 2012}}</ref>
== Career == FitzPatrick was chief executive of [[Anglo Irish Bank]] from 1986 until 2005, when he became its chairman. He resigned from that position in December 2008 when details of secret loans he had taken out with the bank were revealed.
FitzPatrick was appointed to a number of positions by [[Fianna Fáil]] politicians. In 1998 the then Minister for the Environment and Local Government [[Noel Dempsey]] appointed FitzPatrick to the [[Dublin Docklands Development Authority]] where he served until 2007.<ref>Murphy, C. (2009)'Seanie's plaything? Disgraced banker Sean Fitzpatrick is inextricably linked to the Docklands Authority. Should we be worried?' (online) Available at [http://www.herald.ie/national-news/city-news/seanies-plaything-1641391.html Herald.ie] (last accessed 26 April 2010</ref> FitzPatrick was also appointed as a non-executive to the Irish airline [[Aer Lingus]] in March 2004<ref>Aer Lingus Group Plc (2006) Annual Report 2005 (Online) Available at [http://www.aerlingus.com/Corporate/Current_Report/AL_AnnualReport2005.pdf AirLingus.com] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110604113105/http://www.aerlingus.com/Corporate/Current_Report/AL_AnnualReport2005.pdf |date= 4 June 2011 }} (last accessed 26 April 2010)</ref> by the prominent [[Fianna Fáil]] politician and then Minister for Transport [[Séamus Brennan]]<ref>Department of Transport (2004)Transport Minister Announces Appointments to Board of Aer Lingus [online] Available at [http://www.transport.ie/viewitem.asp?id=5552&lang=ENG&loc=1801 Transport.ie] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110615054844/http://www.transport.ie/viewitem.asp?id=5552&lang=ENG&loc=1801 |date=15 June 2011 }} (last accessed 26 April 2010</ref>
== Resignation == When news of his secret loans became public and FitzPatrick resigned as chairman, the resulting furore also swept from office Ireland's chief banking regulator, [[Patrick Neary]]. FitzPatrick, while Anglo Irish chairman, had borrowed more than €100 million from the bank and hid the loans from auditors for eight years. The former multi-millionaire banker defaulted on the loans following a series of major business setbacks, valuable shareholding in Anglo Irish Bank once worth €80 million is now worthless followed by a failed oil venture in Africa and a stake in a casino in Asia stalled. His property investments in Ireland and Hungary were also hit by the international slump.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/fitzpatrick-not-paying-off-euro100m-loan-interest-1901222.html|title=FitzPatrick not paying off €100m loan interest|date=1 October 2009|work=[[Irish Independent]]|publisher=[[Independent News & Media]]|accessdate=18 March 2010|first=Sam|last=Smyth}}</ref>
Both FitzPatrick and the bank said in statements on his resignation that his handling of the loans was neither illegal nor a breach of Irish banking regulations. But an apologetic new chairman O'Connor told shareholders that FitzPatrick's loans were "wrong and unacceptable".
The following day, headlines in the Irish papers illuminated the popular mood: "Seán FitzPatrick Should Go To Jail" competed with "If FitzPatrick Lived in New York, He'd Have Been Arrested By Now".<ref>{{cite news | url=https://www.usatoday.com/money/world/2009-01-28-sean-fitzpatrick-irish-bank_N.htm?csp=34 | title=Irish stand united in hatred of banker Seán FitzPatrick | work=[[USA Today]] | accessdate=18 March 2010 | date=30 January 2009 | author=David J. Lynch}}</ref>
{{quote|It is clear to me, on reflection, that it was inappropriate and unacceptable from a transparency point of view.|<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/banksandfinance/3850245/Anglo-Irish-chairman-Sean-FitzPatrick-resigns-over-inappropriate-loan.html|title=Anglo Irish chairman Sean FitzPatrick resigns over 'inappropriate' loan|date=19 December 2008|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=18 March 2010 | location=London | first=Philip | last=Aldrick}}</ref>}}
When he resigned from Anglo Irish Bank, Fitzpatrick also resigned his non-executive directorships at [[Greencore]], [[Aer Lingus]], [[Experian]], [[Smurfit Kappa]], and [[Gartmore Group|Gartmore Irish Growth Fund]].{{Citation needed|date=March 2010}}
=== Arrests and acquittal === On 16 March 2010 [[Garda Síochána|Gardaí]] were given a warrant to search Seán Fitzpatrick's house.<ref name="IT: 18 March 2010">{{cite news|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/breaking/2010/0318/breaking25.html|title=Former Anglo chairman Seán FitzPatrick arrested|author=Conor Lally|date=18 March 2010|work=[[The Irish Times]]|publisher=The Irish Times Trust|accessdate=18 March 2010}}</ref> FitzPatrick was arrested at around 06:30 on 18 March 2010 at his house in [[Greystones]], [[County Wicklow]]. He was arrested by the Garda Bureau of Fraud Investigation.<ref name="Irish Inde 18 March 2010">{{cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/former-anglo-chief-fitzpatrick-arrested-by-fraud-squad-2103443.html|title=Former Anglo chief FitzPatrick arrested by fraud squad|date=18 March 2010|work=Irish Independent|publisher=Independent News & Media|accessdate=18 March 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/03/19/business/global/19anglobank.html|title=Police Said to Arrest Former Head of Irish Bank|author=David Jolly|date=18 March 2010|work=[[The New York Times]]|publisher=[[Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, Jr.]]|accessdate=18 March 2010}}</ref> He was questioned under Section 4 of the Criminal Justice Act 1984. Under this he was able to be held for up to six hours without charge, but this was later extended.<ref name="RTÉ: 18 March 2010">{{cite news|url=http://www.rte.ie/news/2010/0318/bray.html |title=Sean FitzPatrick held in Anglo fraud inquiry |date=18 March 2010 |work=[[RTÉ News and Current Affairs|RTÉ News]] |publisher=[[Raidió Teilifís Éireann|RTÉ]] |accessdate=18 March 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100322192554/http://www.rte.ie/news/2010/0318/bray.html |archivedate=22 March 2010 |df= }}</ref> The Gardaí were also assisting another investigation by the [[Director of Corporate Enforcement]] for breach of company law.<ref name="IT: 18 March 2010" /> The Gardaí confirmed in a statement that "There is an extensive Garda investigation under way, eager to see justice take its course" In most western countries it is illegal to run a business and seek investment while insolvent.<ref name="Reuters 18 March 2010">{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSLDE62H0YP20100318|title=Police arrest Anglo Irish Bank's former chairman|date=18 March 2010|work=[[Reuters]]|author=Padraic Halpin|author2=Andras Gergely|accessdate=18 March 2010}}</ref> It was not confirmed by the Gardaí at first if FitzPatrick was the person in their custody,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20100318-irish-police-fraud-squad-arrests-ex-bank-boss |title=Irish police fraud squad arrests ex-bank boss |publisher=[[Agence France-Presse]] via ''[[France24]]'' |date=18 March 2010 |accessdate=18 March 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100331203250/http://www.france24.com/en/20100318-irish-police-fraud-squad-arrests-ex-bank-boss |archivedate=31 March 2010 |df= }}</ref> but by an independent source and [[Raidió Teilifís Éireann|RTÉ]].<ref name="Reuters 18 March 2010" /> Following the arrest, without naming FitzPatrick, the [[Minister for Finance (Ireland)|Minister for Finance]] [[Brian Lenihan Jnr|Brian Lenihan]] commented on the situation.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://news.sky.com/skynews/Home/Business/Fraud-Squad-Questions-Sean-FitzPatrick-Former-Head-Of-Anglo-Irish-Bank/Article/201003315576604?lpos=Business_First_Buisness_Article_Teaser_Region_3&lid=ARTICLE_15576604_Fraud_Squad_Questions_Sean_FitzPatrick%2C_Former_Head_Of_Anglo_Irish_Bank|title=Fraud Squad Questions Former Irish Banker|author=Hazel Tyldesley|date=18 March 2010|work=[[Sky News]]|publisher=[[British Sky Broadcasting|BSkyB]]|accessdate=18 March 2010}}</ref> After more than 24 hours of questioning, he was released without charge on 19 March 2010. A file was prepared for the [[Director of Public Prosecutions]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/frontpage/2010/0320/1224266710923.html|title=FitzPatrick makes plan to protect himself from creditors|date=20 March 2010|work=[[The Irish Times]]|publisher=The Irish Times Trust|author=Simon Carswell|author2=Conor Lally|author3=Steven Carroll|accessdate=20 March 2010}}</ref>
On Friday 9 December 2011, Fitzpatrick was arrested a second time by Gardaí, allegedly as part of an investigation into "Financial Irregularities at a Financial Institution".<ref>{{cite news |url=https://twitter.com/rtenews/status/145062425933254656%7C |publisher=[[RTÉ News]] |title=tweet regarding second arrest of Fitzpatrick|date=9 December 2011}}</ref>
On 24 July 2012, Fitzpatrick was arrested a third time by Gardaí, allegedly as part of an investigation into "Financial Irregularities at a Financial Institution" <ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.rte.ie/news/2012/0724/former-anglo-chief-sean-fitzpatrick-arrested.html%7C |publisher=[[RTÉ News]] |title=tweet regarding third arrest of Fitzpatrick|date=24 July 2012}}</ref> He was charged with 16 offences by Gardaí attached to the Office of the Director of Corporate Enforcement relating to his role in advising on and lending millions to a golden circle of investors to falsely inflate Anglo's share price.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/sean-fitzpatrick-bailed-after-16-fraud-offence-charges-3179074.html | work=Independent | title=Sean FitzPatrick bailed after 16 fraud offence charges | date=24 July 2012}}</ref>
After the ODCE's investigation methods were found to be flawed, on 23 May 2017 the judge in Fitzpatrick's trial directed that he be acquitted of all charges.<ref>{{cite news |first=Declan |last=Brennan |date=23 May 2017 |work=[[Irish Independent]] |accessdate=23 May 2017 |url=http://www.independent.ie/irish-news/courts/sean-fitzpatrick-acquitted-on-all-counts-after-direction-of-trial-judge-35746310.html |title=Sean FitzPatrick acquitted on all counts after direction of trial judge }}</ref>
==Irish Life and Permanent transaction 2008== In 2010 it was revealed that Sean Fitzpatrick, David Drumm, and former Anglo Irish Bank finance director Willie McAteer and Peter Fitzpatrick former director of finance at Irish Life and Permanent had '[[prima facie]]' cases to answer in relation to their roles in controversial dealings at Anglo Irish Bank and transactions to Irish Life and Permanent, according to reports prepared by John Purcell, a special investigator. Purcell reports were submitted to the Complaints Committee of the Chartered Accountants Regulatory Board on 14 December 2010, and forwarded to the board’s Disciplinary Committee.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.irishtimes.com/newspaper/breaking/2010/1220/breaking31.html | work=The Irish Times | title='Cases to answer' over Anglo | date=12 December 2010}}</ref><ref>http://www.thejournal.ie/sean-fitzpatrick-and-david-drumm-face-disciplinary-tribunal-in-new-year-2010-12/</ref>
In this context Sean FitzPatrick is tried for:
* Temporarily transferring his loans from Anglo Irish Bank to Irish Life and Permanent to avoid financial statements * more Irish Life and Permanent transactions in 2008. * A Willie McAteer loan of 2008
David Drumm is tried for:
* Temporarily transferring FitzPatrick's loans from Anglo Irish Bank to avoid the financial statements * The Irish Life and Permanent transactions in 2008. * The alteration of terms for ten key customers * Loans to four other key management personnel
Willie McAteer is tried for:
* Temporarily transferring his loans from Anglo Irish Bank to avoid financial statements * The Irish Life and Permanent transactions in 2008. * Not declaring a loan in 2008
Peter Fitzpatrick is tried for:
* Irish Life and Permanent transactions in 2008.
==Bankruptcy== Former chairman of [[Anglo Irish Bank]] Sean FitzPatrick was declared [[Bankruptcy in the Republic of Ireland|bankrupt]] by the Irish High Court on 12 July 2010.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.rte.ie/news/2010/0712/anglo.html | work=RTÉ News | title=Sean FitzPatrick is declared bankrupt | date=12 July 2010}}</ref> The assets and debts of Sean FitzPatrick are now under the control of the official assignee, Chris Lehane, a court-appointed official under the bankruptcy legislation.
==See also== * [[Post-2008 Irish economic downturn]] * [[Irish property bubble]] * [[Michael Fingleton]]
== References == {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== *[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/banksandfinance/3850245/Anglo-Irish-chairman-Sean-FitzPatrick-resigns-over-inappropriate-loan.html Anglo Irish chairman Seán FitzPatrick resigns over 'inappropriate' loan], Philip Aldrick, [[Daily Telegraph]], 19 December 2008 *[https://www.reuters.com/article/managementIssues/idUSLI25523720090118 Ireland to restrict accounts of big Anglo debtors], [[Reuters.com]], 18 January 2009
{{Great Recession}}
{{Authority control}}

revision.comment: /* top */clean up, removed: |ethnicity = Mountain Jew<ref>[http://www.kp.ru/online/news/506753/ Московская община горских евреев заступилась за Тельмана Исмаилова] {{ru icon}}</ref>
revision.text:
{{Infobox person |name = Telman Ismailov |image = |image_size = |caption = |birth_name = Telman Mardanovich Ismailov |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1956|10|26|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Baku]], [[Azerbaijan Soviet Socialist Republic|Azerbaijan SSR]] |death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> |death_place = |body_discovered = |death_cause = |resting_place = |resting_place_coordinates = <!-- {{coord|LAT|LONG|display=inline,title}} --> |residence = |nationality = Azerbaijani (former), Russian, Turkish (naturalised) |citizenship = |other_names = |known_for = AST Group |education = |alma_mater = |employer = |occupation = [[Businessman]] and [[entrepreneur]] |years_active = |home_town = |salary = |networth = |height = |weight = |title = |term = |predecessor = |successor = |party = |opponents = |boards = |spouse = |partner = |children = Sarkhan and Alekper (sons) |parents = |relations = |callsign = |awards = |signature = |website = [http://www.ast-group.ru/ AST Group Website] |footnotes = |box_width = }} '''Telman Mardanovich Ismailov''' ({{lang-az|Telman Mərdan oğlu İsmayılov}}, {{lang-ru| Те́льман Марда́нович Исмаи́лов}}; born 26 October 1956) is an [[Azerbaijan]]i-born [[businessman]] and [[entrepreneur]] of [[History of the Jews in Azerbaijan|Mountain Jew]] origin.<ref>[http://www.gzt.ru/people/teljman-ismailov/243349.html На взятие Исмаилова] {{ru icon}}</ref> Since Azerbaijan does not allow [[Azerbaijani nationality law|dual citizenship]], he holds [[Russia]]n-[[Turkey|Turkish]] citizenship. He is the [[chairman]] of the Russian AST Group of companies, which is active in many countries.<ref>[http://gorskie.ru/personalii/person36.htm РЕЗИДЕНТ ГРУППЫ АСТ ТЕЛЬМАН ИСМАИЛОВ: У НАС РУБЛЬ СЪЕШЬ - ТРИ ОТДАШЬ] {{ru icon}}</ref> Until 2009, Ismailov owned the Europe's then-largest marketplace, [[Cherkizovsky Market]], located in Moscow, Russia.
==Early life and family== Telman Ismailov was born in [[Baku]], [[USSR]] in 1956, to a business family from Baku. He is the 10th child of a family with 12 children.<ref>[http://www.peoples.ru/undertake/founder/telman_ismailov/ Тельман Марданович Исмаилов - Peoples.ru] {{ru icon}}</ref> Both his father's and mother's family include Muslims and [[Mountain Jews]].<ref>[http://www9.gazetevatan.com/haberdetay.asp?Categoryid=1&Newsid=244668]{{tr icon}}</ref>
==Business career== ===Current assets=== In 1989, he registered the brand "AST" (initials of his two sons (Alekper, Sarkhan) and himself).<ref name="Telman">[http://pragent.ru/prostopr/ismailov/ PR-кампания Тельмана Исмаилова] {{ru icon}}</ref>
After the lavish opening of a hotel resort in [[Antalya]], Russia's prime minister [[Vladimir Putin]] was reportedly enraged that Ismailov invested so much abroad and flaunted his riches while Russia was being hit by a credit crunch.<ref>https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/oligarch-pays-for-party-that-enraged-putin-1748289.html</ref> In retaliation, the angry Putin ordered the closing of Cherkizovsky Market in 2009, causing 100,000 traders at the famous bazaar to lose their jobs.
==Lifestyle== Known for his extravagant life style, Ismailov is famous for spending millions of dollars on [[singers]] like [[Jennifer Lopez]], [[Mariah Carey]], [[Tom Jones (singer)|Tom Jones]], and others. Ismailov paid [[Lopez]] $1.4 million for her to sing 10 minutes worth of songs.{{citation needed|date=March 2017}} The video of her singing "[[Happy Birthday to You|Happy Birthday]]" song to him is available on YouTube. Ismailov befriended plenty of other celebrities such as [[actors|actresses]] like [[Sharon Stone]], [[Richard Gere]], [[Monica Bellucci]], [[Paris Hilton]], and numerous other performers just to appear at his lavish parties.<ref>[http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/liverpool-life/fashion/2009/06/03/glitz-and-glamour-for-all-in-turkey-100252-23776517/ Glitz and glamour for all in Turkey]</ref>
==See also== * [[List of Azerbaijanis]] * [[Mardan Palace]] * [[Azerbaijani Jews]] * [[Mountain Jews]]
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090605002437/http://www.ast-group.ru/ AST Group - Official Site] {{ru icon}} * [http://rutube.ru/tracks/1997455.html/ Mardan Palace Opening Night] * [http://news.bakililar.az/print_22357.html/ Grand opening] * [http://www.goabroad.ru/news/2009-05-31/ Long awaited night] * [http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article6591398.ece]

revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=December 2015}} {{Infobox video game |title = The Biz |image = TheBizTitleScreen.gif |caption = Title screen |developer = [[Virgin Group|Virgin Games]] |publisher = [[Virgin Group|Virgin Games]] |designer = [[Chris Sievey]]<ref name="worldofspectrum">{{cite web | url = http://www.worldofspectrum.org/infoseekid.cgi?id=0000544| title = Designer/# of players information | publisher = [[World of Spectrum]]| date = | accessdate = 2011-03-21}}</ref> |released = {{vgrelease|EU|1984}} |genre = [[Simulation game|Simulation]] |modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]]<ref name="worldofspectrum"/> |platform = [[ZX Spectrum]] }}
'''''The Biz''''' is a management simulation game published by [[Virgin Group|Virgin Games]] for the [[ZX Spectrum]] in 1984. In ''The Biz'', the player manages a [[rock music|rock]] band. The price of the game on release was £6.95, which is equivalent to £{{formatnum:{{Inflation|UK|6.95|1984|r=2}}}} today. The tape cassette contained the program, an interview with [[Frank Sidebottom]] and [[Chris Sievey]], and eight singles.<ref name="zxspectrumreviews"/>
==Gameplay== [[File:TheBizZXSpectrumScreenshot.jpg|250px|left|In this screeenshot, the player's father has won £40,000 while gambling on football. Unfortunately, the player only gets £10 as a way to keep the game balanced.]]
Players set up their rock band with [[Gig (musical performance)|gig]]s, make them [[rehearsal|rehearse]] new [[song]]s, and hire a [[recording studio]] for producing new [[album]]s. The player starts out with no talent or [[pound sterling|money]] and an [[talent agent|agent]] must be hired in order to better co-ordinate the band. The stage presence of the band and the [[fandom|fanbase]] are improved with every gig performed. School [[Dance party|dance]]s and [[YMCA]]s are the first places that accept the player's newly formed band. Real television stations are included: a band from either [[Swansea]] or [[Cardiff]] would perform on [[S4C]] while a local band from [[Coventry]] would get promoted on [[Central Independent Television|Central Television]]. Players can sometimes record a [[List of Peel sessions|session]] with [[John Peel]]; whose broadcasting influence opened up new bands to people between the ages of 20 and 60 years of age.
Mundane details such as [[insurance]], standard [[musical instrument]]s and transportation [[expense]]s are all tabulated against the player's savings in the game. The game also contains an anti-[[drug]] message for bands who consider experimenting with them.
==Reviews== The game only contains sound effects and no music, although eight singles were included on the cassette. There are no graphics to speak of and the game is [[text-based game|text-based]]. A [[Crash (magazine)|Crash]] review in March 1985 praised the game, stating that it was ''"[a]n unusually absorbing and addictive strategy/simulation with a sense of humour that represents good value."''<ref name="zxspectrumreviews">{{cite web | url = http://www.zxspectrumreviews.co.uk/Review.aspx?rid=5429&gid=661| title = Criticism of game | publisher = ZX Spectrum Reviews| date = | accessdate = 2011-03-21}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Biz, The}} [[Category:1984 video games]] [[Category:Business simulation games]] [[Category:Europe-exclusive video games]] [[Category:Single-player video games]] [[Category:Strategy video games]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Video games set in England]] [[Category:ZX Spectrum games]] [[Category:ZX Spectrum-only games]]

{{notability|Books|date=July 2017}} {{italic title}} {{Infobox book | name = Twitter Power: How to Dominate Your Market One Tweet at a Time | title_orig = | translator = | image = Twitterpower3.jpg | caption = Cover | author = [[Joel Comm]] | illustrator = | country = United States | language = English | series = | subject = [[Internet Marketing]], [[Business]] | genre = Non-fiction, | publisher = [[John Wiley & Sons]] | release_date = February 2009 | english_release_date = | media_type = | pages = 248 pp | isbn = 978-0-470-45842-6 | dewey= 658.8/72 22 | congress= HF5415.1265 .C646 2009 | oclc= 262426853 | preceded_by = | followed_by = }}
'''''Twitter Power: How to Dominate Your Market One Tweet at a Time''''' is a book about [[Twitter]] by [[Joel Comm]] published in [[2009 in literature|2009]]. It introduces readers to [[Twitter]], explaining how to create a Twitter account, market their brands, and gain Twitter followers.
Published by [[John Wiley & Sons]], the book generally received positive reviews. It was criticized by a [[CNET]] reviewer for giving readers "a phony formula where you just paint by the numbers" to attempt to ensnare Twitter followers as customers.<ref name="Cooper2009-02-13">{{cite news |last=Cooper |first=Charles |date=2009-02-13 |title=Twitter power? For real? |url=http://www.cnet.com/news/twitter-power-for-real/ |publisher=[[CNET]] |accessdate=2015-09-13 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6bVHhh97L |archivedate=2015-09-13 }}</ref>
==Synopsis== The book aims to teach business owners how to use [[microblogging]] service [[Twitter]] to network and build a community around their services, and to use tweets for [[viral marketing]].<ref name="Elliott">{{cite news |last=Elliott |first=Christopher |date=2009-01-16 |title=Changing travel one tweet at a time |url=http://www.nbcnews.com/id/28623823/ |publisher=[[MSNBC]] |accessdate=2015-09-13 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6bVQT2xhF |archivedate=2015-09-13 }}</ref> Comm describes and provides examples of five tweet groups: "classic, mission-accomplished, question, entertainment and picture tweets".<ref name="Dill2010-01-10">{{cite news |last = Dill|first = Margo L.|date = 2010-01-10|title = The Power of Twitter|url = http://infoweb.newsbank.com/resources/doc/nb/news/12D82CDBDF28E208?p=AWNB|newspaper = [[The News-Gazette (Champaign-Urbana)|The News-Gazette]]|accessdate = 2015-09-13|archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/6bVErAkuW|archivedate = 2015-09-13}}</ref>
In ''Twitter Power''{{'}} resources section, Comm includes a list of "Power Twitterers". He also lists Twitters tools like [[TweetDeck]], a dashboard, and [[Twellow]], a user directory.<ref name="Dill2010-01-10"/> [[Tony Robbins]] wrote the book's preface.<ref name="Cooper2009-02-13"/>
==Reception== ''[[The News-Gazette (Champaign-Urbana)|The News-Gazette]]''{{'}}s Margo L. Dill said the book is best suited for Internet marketers who want people to view a website or to sell merchandise. She said that reading articles about Twitter instead of the book would be preferable for people using Twitter for personal use like keeping up to date with celebrities. Dill praised the book for being an "easy read for a book about technology and social marketing".<ref name="Dill2010-01-10"/>
In [[CNET]] article titled "Twitter power? For real?", journalist Charles Cooper criticized the book for providing a "phony formula where you just paint by the numbers".<ref name="Cooper2009-02-13"/> He said the book is "devoted to doling out tips on how to game the system to reel in 'loyal customers and more sales overall'".<ref name="Cooper2009-02-13"/> Cooper found ''Twitter Power'' contradictory because it says that Twitter is "not a place where people come to sell—and pushing sales hard on Twitter just isn't going to work", but almost immediately after says that following people on Twitter could get them to become customers.<ref name="Cooper2009-02-13"/>
Mike Werling of ''[[Entrepreneur (magazine)|Entrepreneur]]'' described ''Twitter Power'' as "Joel Comm's ode to the haiku of blogging".<ref name="Werling2009-02-10">{{cite news |last = Werling|first = Mike|date = 2009-02-10|title = Twitter Gets Its Own Book|url = http://www.entrepreneur.com/article/218355|newspaper = [[Entrepreneur (magazine)|Entrepreneur]]|accessdate = 2015-09-13|archiveurl = https://www.webcitation.org/6bVHFP3gw|archivedate = 2015-09-13}}</ref> [[Linda L. Richards]] wrote in ''[[January Magazine]]'' that ''Twitter Power'' was a "blazingly lucid book" that is "well thought out, friendly and entirely easy to follow".<ref name="Richards2009-03-18">{{cite news |last=Richards |first=Linda L. |authorlink=Linda L. Richards |date=2009-03-18 |title=Non-Fiction: Twitter Power by Joel Comm |url=http://januarymagazine.com/wp/non-fiction-twitter-power-by-joel-co/ |newspaper=[[January Magazine]] |accessdate=2015-09-13 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6bVHFXpfT |archivedate=2015-09-13 }}</ref> ''[[Mint (newspaper)|Mint]]'' columnist [[Sidin Vadukut]] extolled the book for being "free of jargon and effective" and that Comm "writes with a jocular simplicity that makes you want to play along".<ref name="Vadukut2009-06-11">{{cite news |last=Vadukut |first=Sidin |authorlink=Sidin Vadukut |date=2009-06-11 |title=Shift control, and twitter |url=http://www.livemint.com/Leisure/WyN2mhFU3bHYUM7W752XLN/Shift-control-and-twitter.html |newspaper=[[Mint (newspaper)|Mint]] |accessdate=2015-09-13 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6bVHt2KaM |archivedate=2015-09-13 }}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * [http://twitterpower.com/ Official website]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Twitter Power}} [[Category:2009 books]] [[Category:American non-fiction books]] [[Category:Books about the Internet]] [[Category:Business books]] [[Category:Twitter]]

'''Waiariki Institute of Technology''' ({{lang-mi|Whare Takiura o Waiariki}}) was a tertiary institution based in the city of [[Rotorua]], [[New Zealand]], in the [[Bay of Plenty]] region in the central North Island. In May 2016, it merged with [[Bay of Plenty Polytechnic]] to form [[Toi Ohomai Institute of Technology]]. Regional campuses existed in [[Taupo]], [[Tokoroa]] and [[Whakatane]], and formerly [[Turangi]] and [[Kawerau]]. These were backed by a variety of specialist campuses and buildings, such as the Waipa Campus just south of Rotorua and the newly established offerings available from Waiariki in the [[Tauranga]] suburb of Windermere. Waiariki was divided into three faculties, which offered masters, graduate, postgraduate and degree qualifications, as well as diplomas and certificates in several subject areas. They were the Faculty of Applied Technology and Primary Industries - Te Kura Takawāo, the Faculty of Business, Information Technology and Creative Arts - Te Kura Taki, and Te Pākaro a Ihenga: Faculty of Health, Education and Humanities. Qualification subject areas included [[nursing]], [[teaching]], [[social work]], [[art]], [[sustainability]], [[Māori culture|Māori]], [[forestry]], [[business]], [[computing]], [[tourism]] and [[hospitality]]. These were backed by an equally diverse range of trade-based qualifications, in areas such as [[engineering]], [[agriculture]], [[horticulture]], [[fashion]], [[carpentry]] and [[hairdressing]]. == Tangatarua Marae == Waiariki has an on-site [[marae]] named Tangatarua, which translates as "two peoples" to reflect their [[bicultural]] nature. Tangatarua Marae was officially opened on 5 October 1996 and is named after a Túhourangi ancestor, Ihenga, who lived on the land where the Mokoia Campus is today. == Academies == The Waiariki Academy of Sport offered talented athletes the opportunity to prioritise their sporting careers while gaining a tertiary education. Similarly, the Waiariki Academy of Singing and Music supported talented young singers and musicians to reach their musical goals while studying. Waiariki also offered teenagers interested in trade areas the Bay of Plenty Trades Academy, which allowed secondary students to get a taste of trade subjects and tertiary life while still at high-school. == History == Waiariki Community College was born in 1976, after the Rotorua Boys’ High School Technical Institute Division was merged with the Rotorua Girls' High School Business College to form a Senior Technical Division under the Rotorua High Schools' Board of Governors. Building on the Mokoia Drive site commenced that year, and the Waiariki Community College was opened two years later on 1 April 1978. Tokoroa's 'outpost' opened in 1973, and subsequently became Waiariki’s first regional campus in 1978. By the time Waiariki Community College changed its name to Waiariki Polytechnic in 1987, it was the largest polytechnic outside of the main city centres. The first two degree-level qualifications in tourism management and nursing were launched in 1995, and three years later, the name finally changed to Waiariki Institute of Technology. ==See also== *[[List of forestry universities and colleges]] ==External links== *[http://www.waiariki.ac.nz Waiariki Institute of Technology website] *[http://www.facebook.com/waiariki.tangata Facebook profile] [[Category:Vocational education in New Zealand]] [[Category:Universities and colleges in New Zealand]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1978]] [[Category:Business incubators of New Zealand]] [[Category:Education in the Bay of Plenty Region]]
